This series certainly beats most primetime TV shows and it's nice to be able to watch it on my schedule.
Wholesome with great acting.  I love the historical perspective intertwined with the human drama and conditions.  Humanity in both villages struggle to do the best they can.
This show is enspiring, joyful,mall emotions  and full of love thru good and bad times.  Great intertainment...great actors and actresses.  Could not stop watching.
Great show. You will get to know and fall in love with all the characters. Recommend  you watch season one first.

Love British anything, and this cast and story lines are fantastic. The central hub of the larger village is the post office where it is easy to know everybody's business. The motivation is always to be helpful, but sometimes the results are anything but.
Great representation of life during that time period. Of course it's romantisized, but they did a good job. I wish it never ended.
good clean fun. not a drama soap opera like other popular british shows at the moment. a show about the common people.
A story of hard time in a small village and how everyone help one another. I am in enjoy it.

The ramblings of the neighboring farmers and the elite town folk come further to life in season two. There are plenty of new surprises. To be sure, you won't find a boring moment throughout this wonderfully prepared and acted British series. Get ready for a delightful binge!

Great show. Love the setting, the time period, and the clothes. The show is about caring for your neighbor and coming together as a community. I am really enjoying this series. Highly recommend Lark Rise to Candleford
I love the characters and the story line!  I was very involved in the series and disappointed when it ended.

I CHOSE FIVE STARS BECAUSE I THINK LARK RISE TO CANDLEFORNDIS A PLEASURE TO WATCH WITHOUT ALL OF THE NASTY PROFANITY THAT IS IN MOST PROGRAMS NOW DAYS.
THE REFERENCES TO PERSONAL "THINGS" ARE SO COMICAL. POOR MRS. THOMAS BROWN.....WILL SHE EVER GET TO USE HER BED FOR MORE THAN "ENDEVERING" ? THE PLEASENTRIES OF THE OLD ERAS ARE FINE TO LISTEN TO !

Very similar to the 1st season with 1 or two new people to meet.  This program was equally enjoyed and similar in genre to Cranford.  Though only 1 season of Cranford is available free on instant Prime.
This is one of the best series that we have watched from BBC.  Very well done and keeps your interest.
My only issue with this series is every time Dorcas Lane gets an eligible suitor the writers make sure she is too high and mighty to invite him into her life. Otherwise, great season
Every actor brought their own impact to the show! I wish this series would've continued! I'll watch it over and over again!
This is a great TV show even though some of the characters are off the wall.  It still holds your interest.
Looking forward to the next! Very interesting characters with a twist and a smile.  An engaging look into that time period.
I really enjoy this series. Every episode is well done With very little objectionable material. How refreshing!  I wish there was more television programming of this caliber.
A LOOK BACK IN TIME INTO ORDINARY LIVES... SOME VERY POOR AND SOME MIDDLE CLASS, WITH A LORD OR LADY ONCE IN A GREAT WHILE
This really is a great show. I would recommend this to anyone who appreciates a well written wholesome style of programming.

This is one of the most delightful series I have watched in a  while.  There is no comparison to British TV.  The stories are told with such insight and I love the landscape.  The characters are so unique and after a while you feel that you know each and every one so well.  Little Minnie was just adorable.  Would love to see more of these type of shows.  It seems so much that we are subjected to have inappropriate language, not suitable for all ages.  Please give us more of  your wonderful shows.  By the way, every season was great.  I feel bad that it's over.
a nice good, all around series.  A feel good type of series.  I enjoy it very much and hope to see more of it
Great story that developed beautifully from season to season. It will make you laugh and cry...sometimes at the same time;) Quality acting too.

It was fun to watch the history of events while enjoying an engaging tale. Good character development...settings and costumes were lovely. Wish there was another season. Kind of British version of Little House on the Prairie.
It's a very fun and lighthearted program. The main characters have a sweetness about then but are going through done very real issues.
This is the type of series that you wish continued. You love the characters and how they develop and grow. Happy with the ending.

This season could do without the superstitions and ghosts and affair though... why do shows have to do that that is so annoying
?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?!?

I enjoy this series because it is clean and real. The dramas can seem trivial sometimes based on just rumors and simple miscommunications, but they are dramas of everyday life that we can all relate to when we consider our own lives.
This a wonderful BBC series and, to me, is excellent family entertainment.  Wish they still produced series like this.  Mrs. HFC
It is very nice to see great acting ,basically correct scenery and period fixtures and story line, without the violence of todays drama shows.
This show was extremely well-written and superbly acted. Very nuanced performances. What a pleasure to see true artists! Worth every penny of the cost for Prime.
My daughter and I are hooked on this show!!! The characters are so rich in personalitiespersonalities and the story lines are wonderful!

Very well written and beautiful costumes. love the romance of the characters. wish darcus would make up her mind,Great!
show just in season 2 and look forward to more.
Incredibly well-done. Great script, great cast, great acting, great costumes and set design--can't get enough. We're just sad that there are only 40 episodes of Lark Rise.
The series  has a quality plot with great scenery.  The characters are well developed and their moral values are refreshing.

This may have been a good episode but how can one tell? It appears there has been an "upgrade" to the streaming Amazon.com interface. It no longer seems to check for bandwidth and adjust quality of streamed product to match bandwidth -  so we poor slobs who have slow DSL in rural areas now find we can no longer get streaming video over Amazon.com without buffering every 2 minutes. And just after renewing the subscription at a higher cost - I get poorer service. Another miscalculation by Amazon.
I was so sorry to arrive at the last episode of the last season.  I thoroughly enjoyed the entire collection
Outstanding writing and character development.  Authentic to the period.  Interesting story lines with great acting.  Entertaining and also most informative.

One of the best tv series ever. The entire family can share time watching this series. The only problems are...you can't stop watching and you want it to go on forever. I may wait 6 months and watch this one again.
If you are looking for an interesting story with great characters this is it.  So refreshing to relax and watch a show without guns, violence, swearing, and sex!
Wonderful faith based series for the whole family with a moral lession after each show. American TV could learn much from the BBC.

Season 2 of "Lark Rise to Candleford" is not my favorite season, but it is still done very well and has some classic episodes, such as the Cabbage Patterson-Miss Pratt episode. If you haven't gotten hooked by the end of season 1, you will be by the end of this season. And the season gets better with each episode. You will want to watch season 3 to see how certain events from season 2 are revisited!

I love "Lark Rise to Candleford."  It is not a classic series and may not ever win awards; it is sweet and sappy, and that is why I love it.  It is a great escape from the mayhem and destruction of the daily news!  The actors are lovely and everything always turns out good in the end!

I cannot watch 'Lark Rise' season 2 because of the long, tedious, constant buffering.  10 minutes to buffer, 1 minute of show time.  Then we repeat the process.  After not having problems with other series and season 1 of this great show, it has beaten me.  I give up.  I'm done.  The Amazon Prime instant videos just don't work.  ...sigh....

I am addicted to this series.  The characters are genuine and authentic, the storyline is charming and heartfelt.
I look forward to my visits to Candleford and Lark Rise !

Wonderful colorful characters well portrayed by seasoned actors. An interesting perspective of residents daily lives and interactions between the very small town and a smaller neighboring hamlet. Very entertaining.
just as enjoyable as season one. Claudie Blakley is such a good actress, as are the other actors in the series. looking forward to season 3.
This is a heartwarming, endearing program that makes you want to be a part of Lark Rise. The characters are charming, in their own quirky ways and leave you wanting more.
It was a most enjoyable program. It had some very delightful characters and some very good actors playing the parts.
I continue to be fully entertained and entwined in the families of both Candleford and Lark Rise.  I would prefer they would leave out the ghosts, etc., however.

This is a well written, produced and directed series, never dull and I find myself wondering what I would do if I were faced with some of the situations in their time.  I love the Dorcas character.  A strong woman with independence and a strong will.  I would recommend this for any age, and it can be watched by all without fear of distasteful language or content.
It's something that you can lose yourself in, forget the cares of the day. I loved all the characters and the problems of simple life.

Thank you to the actors, and everyone else who is involved in the making of this series. I love how there is nothing in this that I would not want my children to see, and even more importantly, all of it that I want them to see. There is a great lesson in every episode.
Love this show.  Definitely right there with Downton Abby, except this is probably a little more Family Friendly! I highly recommend this tv series.
One of the best series we've seen!  I would highly recommend it  - family friendly - well written & the acting is fantastic! Fell in love with the folks in Lark Rise & Candleford!
I enjoy the different characters in this series.  They are entertaining and full of real life problems.  I also enjoy getting familiar with the British customs and culture during this time period.

Always something new happening! Held my interest in the characters as they go forward with their lives, sometimes bringing tears to my eyes and other times upset with the outcome..maybe would do it different but all in all an interesting drama...

This is my new favorite show.

It is so interesting and entertaining.  I really love the characters, especially Dorcas Lane.

I've been so drawn in to the lives of these people.  Such good acting, and a believable glimpse into what life was like in the late 19th century.  I watch an episode nearly every night on my Kindle Fire HDX.
Good clean family viewing. Hard to find these days. You will find yourself wishing it had lasted longer. We couldn't stop watching.

This is some of the best TV out there..  very well written, uplifting story lines with good moral lesson; excellent cinematography.. we need more of this and less of the garbage that's so popular today featuring immorality, violence, and spiritism..
I enjoyed watching all four seasons of this series.  It is one of my favorites but I was not able to see seasons 2 through 4.  I was thrilled to find it on Amazon Prime.
I Love this show so much!!! So heartwarming and sweet!!! I love the characters and storyline!! The writing is wonderful!!
Great wholesome show. Great cast. I see several Dowtown Abbey characters. Love finding little gems like this show. Will continue to watch.
I really like the movie. It's one you can watch with your whole family. You want to try watching the shows.

My husband and I have enjoyed this TV series immensely and have been watching at least one episode a day and are now on Season 3.  The actors and actresses are so believable and the story line is so well done.  We are looking forward to watching Season 4 too.
Love this series. With so little good programming on regular or cable TV it's nice to know there's a sweet alternative. My husband and I have really enjoyed it.
The whole series is great from beginning to end.  It made me laugh, cry, and laugh some more.  I loved it!
Episodes are varied and the characters become developed with each episodes. Only the Lark Rise folks enjoy their lives more fully.
I love it and am totally hooked. Sweet, gentle, funny, with little life lessons thrown in. Nice to see British actors. They look more real than Hollywood actors
Sets and costumes are beautiful. I feel like I know these characters personally. So glad I found this series. Terrific.

My husband and I love British TV series and have enjoyed this one.  We look forward to a new episode each evening.  It's so nice to find a series that is family friendly and does not have to be prescreened.
Excellent cast and ensemble acting. Anyone who enjoys Upstairs Downstairs, Downton Abby and all other BBC period series, will enjoy Lark Rise
This is one of the best shows I've ever seen. I have watched season one and season two and have started on season 3.  It is a very well-done saga of a young girl as she begins her adult life.
I love this show. It is my favorite series. It is uplifting, makes you think, and is not full of negativity.
L this is a delightfully clever show. Love it totally addicted to the funny quirky characters. Great time period stories.

GREAT SHOW, I LOVE IT SO MUCH SO I AM RE WATCHING IT. EVERY ONE IN THE SHOW ARE GREAT ACTORS ANS ACTRESSES.
THE PLACE  THIS SHOW WAS MADE IN, IS SIMPLE BEAUTIFUL. I WATCHED ALL THE SEASONS.  PLEASE, PLEASE MAKE MORE, PLEASE CONTINUE WITH  MORE, MUCH MORE.
THANK YOU FOR SUCH GREAT SHOWS.
GEORGE Z

This series is really good with good morales and ethics, something a lot new shows do not have. It is nice to see how everyday life was back then and the things they did not know that we have taken for granted now! I will watch all the seasons and looking at buying the books!
but don't see why I must review each season. The setting is fabulous, the acting even better and you become a part of their families.

This show is one of the best period pieces I've ever seen, and I tend to watch a lot of these types of shows.  Give it a try and you will find yourself immersed in the daily struggles and triumphs of the good folks in Lark Rise and the town folk of Candleford.  Very well done, extremely well acted, and altogether engaging.  I cannot believe that this wonderful show appears to have been cut short in Season 4.  Enjoy it now - and go back to visit whenever you want to get lost in this charming world and its endearing characters.

Great acting and beautiful photography make this UK product a joy to watch. Also, we like that there is not bad language and there is always a good moral to the story. Someone learns a life lesson or that you can't always have what you want. If you are younger this series may seem "quaint" and not "with it ". For the older crowd it reflects the values of an older time. Good stuff!

I am baffled by people who complain this show is too shallow.  How much television have they watched I wonder.  Can't be much, as this is certainly not as shallow as most TV fare.  Folks have noted flaws in storylines, etc, which would matter if this were a genuine documentary or meant to provide a direct story from the books written by the original author, but the show does not pretend to stick to the books, so people need to get over it and enjoy it for the period costumes, quaint characters and well written story lines.
Well cast and well paced soap opera keeps you interested in what will happen next.  Able to deal with the serious and the farcical (sometimes at the same time) makes for excellent viewing.
BBC does it best, again.  Characters are consistent and believable, bitter and sweet.  The costumes, sets and countrysides are beautiful.
This season Lark Rise to Candleford continues with poignant story lines, keeping my interest.  I have recommended this to my friends.
Great series....I want more!  I don't tire of watching it....Wonderful if the series could continue. Please show me more of the same type of stories...I never tire of them
Lark Rise to Candleford is a good series that makes you feel good after watching each session.  The characters are are well played.  Each story has a good lesson about life.
Lovely setting, acting and story lines in this wonderful series.  The stories are uplifting and yet poignant at the same time.  Thoroughly enjoying Season 2 at this time.
I love this show!!! It sucked me in to the drama and happenings of two towns in a bygone era.

BBC has captured the pace-SLOW..... and aura of the 1800's-

The erosion of traditional values can be replaced........If culture survives.....
This is clean, wholesome entertainment that the whole family can enjoy.  The characters are endearing, interesting and deal with life in an uplifting way.

The book was recommended, but before I wanted to commit to the book (which is fairly long) I stuck my toe into the pond with this series.  I am HOOKED.  It helps me to remember to be content in so many ways.  It is a delightful story.  Funny, intense, shocking - well lots of things I could write.  It is simply a fantastic story, with characters that are well developed - you will love it
Lark Rise to Candleford is a delightful series, fit for the whole family or just the two of you.  We have enjoyed it immensely!
I think that the Lark Rise to Candleford series is excellent and well worth watching.  I would wish that it would continue on for quite a few more episodes.

This series is charming and romantic in era.  I like to learn of the social and family issues that were the struggle of the day.  It is interesting for me how progress changed and affected people and towns.  Many likeable characters with different personalities interacting.  Good acting.
I don't watch television much. This show is entertaining and fun to watch,most television I've watched in a long time. Worth the time!
Excellent.  Normal people with normal problems!  A refreshing change and welcome.  Am enjoying each episode more and more.  Wish that there were more productions like this.
Beautifully done. I had only seen a few episodes on PBS. So I was glad to be able to watch the complete series on Amazon Prime Instant Video. Great stories, acting, and filming.
I truly enjoy watching this show.  When I just want to watch something that makes me feel good, the first show I think about is "Larkrise to Candleford".
Great cast and fun storylines.  Feels like a historical novel!  Easy to get caught up in their lives. Lovely setting - especially the village.
nice variety of characters...moves along without belaboring any one subject...I would recommend this for family viewing too...I hope there are more seasons?

Great show. Season 2 follows a wonderful season 1 with some changes and decisions in the lives of the characters we've now grown fond of. New characters are introduced but it continues the same wonderful pattern of heartfelt stories. I skipped the first episode after watching the first 10 minutes or so of it. Its a bit creepy and disturbing in my opinion with the premise of the ghost of a young girl, and may be much for younger audiences or those of us sensitive to that type of subject.

I adore this show.  The  characters make you care about them.  Addictive if you like period pieces.
Highly recommended.  Some very profound moments, too.

It is easy to get caught up in the lives of two communities.  Real people, real struggles, real challenges make up the lives of a Post Mistress, played by Julia Sawalha, and the Stonecutter, Brendan Coyle.  A character Twister Turrill, played by Karl Johnson, will remind you of someone you know.

Here is a honest look at life that will pull you in episode after episode.
Viewers can learn many meaningful statements and interactions.  There are several interesting quotes that viewers would wonder if they're true.

Quirky, but lovable characters abound! Each episode seems to add a new character to mix with the regulars. Keeps the series fresh and interesting. Most of these 'guest" characters come and go at the end of their episode. The wonder of the series is.......each episode ends on a positive note! Through the course of the series, the 'quirky" characters are given their own new dimension......brought to life, so to speak. In all, it IS like a well-written book filled with easy-to-love characters.
A great series, great characters and story lines, would love to see more of this kind of series on TV.
Lark Rise to Candleford Season 2 has been captivating.  Enjoy the characters and story line.  Well done and beautifully filmed.

I finished the 2nd season of Lark  Rise to Candleford and can't wait to watch season 3 . I am enjoying so much this wonderful story of strong women in a time when many women had a hard life . The characters are rich in every way.
The scenery is beautiful and believable to that era.
We are thoroughly enjoying this series as it is a healthy family-based series with lots of drama and events each episode.  Much better than watching local tv programs!!

If you like stories that are rich in conversations and enjoy the interaction of characters appearing deceivingly different - this is a must watch. You will find characters ranging from what  we might label in the modern world, if not loud at least to ourselves,  the fool to the wise; and then you will get to discover how similar they are.

Along the way youll get to enrich your soul with the ever true quotes like Hard work is the greatest Alchemy, What a woman wants as a girl isn't the same as what she wants as a womanevery character you encounter in the serious including those that show up once and disappear will really show you a side of a human being, what appears to be buried and forgotten in the modern age delusions. And if you are a wo/man who thinks objectively about our existence  you will find a lot to discover about yourself on the way. It is Simply Awesome  enjoy!
I love the overall feeling of this series. These villages are an extended family where relationships are deepening and changing and the people are growing together.
This series is based on the English country side in the early 1900's. There are fantastic actors you might see in current shows like Downton Abbey.

We are into season 3 and hope that the series never end. Beautiful scenery, acting and dialogue. About life and it's ups and downs with a solid moral connection. We loved all the episodes from season 1 to season 3, except season 2 episode 1, but maybe that's just me. It's a refreshing series with a sweetness about it. Brendan Coyle, from Downton Abbey, is just as wonderful in Lark Rise.
Love this program. It keeps getting better and better.  Great acting. Stories sometimes far fetched but always enjoyable.  Watch it.
I am most of the way through the 2 season and I don't want it to end., only I have seen a couple of others that look pretty good.,

The show is awesome! I love that Thomas is a christian and it's not hidden. I also love the morals and integrity of the English at those times; I wish it were so today. I love the small community of Lark Rise, and the fact that everybody knows everybody, and everybody gets along for the most part. The natural scenery God created in their time is absolutely beautiful as well.
Enjoyed this series so much - was great to see a couple of the characters portrayed went on to roles in Downton Abbey and The Paradise. If the BBC can produce such good television, why can't the US?
I have very much enjoyed this series.  Each season has been more wonderful getting to know all the characters.  Great!

As I wrote for Season 1, I love this series and I'm so glad I stumbled upon it.  My husband has found me with tears running down my face more than once; the characters are that sincere and the storyline development really draws you in.  I will be sad for this series to end.

I love this time period in history - the characters are believeable and every detail about the settings, language/dialect is believeable.  To me this is more of a "reality" show than what we see everywhere on cable stations.

The characters are very easy to like and the story line keeps you coming back for more.  I'm so glad Amazon has all 4 seasons available for watching with Prime.  My only sadness is that I'm now at the end of season 4!!

As I approach the end of season 2, I'm wishing it would go on and on and on.  Everything about Lark Rise to Candleford is excellent, and I look forward to each new show.

Everything about these programs is top notch - writing, casting, direction, acting, costuming.  It's just so GOOD!
You never want it to end. It creates a whole world into itself. Terrific to watch. We were hooked. Fr

Wish there was more.... Love all of the story lines and characters.  More Please!!!

Thank you for making it available on Amazon Prime

In a world of violent, negative and poorly written television,this series shines as a beacon of quality and goodness. Well written and beautifully acted I look forward to each episode knowing that I will feel good about the time I have spent viewing this work of art.

I love this series of real people dealing with real every day lifelike situations, in spite of the differences in culture and time period.

I feel the episodes are moral and uplifting, with always something good to be learned.

And of course I am now very interested in all of the characters and how they are living.
If you like Victorian period drama, this may be your cup of tea. Employs as usual the skilled actors, costuming, etc. characteristic of BBC productions.

A soulful tale of unfolding life in rural England in the early 20th century.  Endearing, quirky characters; engaging plot lines; beautiful scenery. Large themes writ small and slow make this a winner.
Strong characterization of rural village life with an a fun assortment of personalities. Likeable and cheerful without being sappy! Recommend

The episodes move along quickly with a lot of drama in each to be solved.  The characters are interesting and can be quite funny at times.  There is such a wholesomeness about the time in which they live and are continually accomplishing growth in the two towns.  You will soon have favorite characters and from one episode to the other you will want to know what is next.

The publicity for this series emphasizes the differences between agricultural Lark Rise and the bustling market town of Candleford.  But there's a lot more here: the moral values and belief system of the country folk, the role of Squire at the time, the opportunities for women and the attitudes of men, the strong bonds of family and community.  Outstanding writing, and outstanding performances from the central figures.  Good for regular watching, or for a self-paced marathon at home.
What can I say other than my family is watching it over for the third time. The stories, the acting, & the scenery are just great.
Love it and I hope more seasons are coming . The characters are realistic and I look forward to relax and enjoy this series after evening chores
I am still watching this series and I am though rely  enjoying it. Will report when I am thru. Very addicting
Great character studies in this series. So far nothing offensive to our conservative values. Great for the whole family. Out 9 and 13 year old grandkids like it very much,
A Clean show the whole family can watch.  And the actors do a marvelous job! The storylines are always good.

This series is near the top of my Love Love Love list.  It clearly has important moral themes which are treated with respect; right from wrong, apologize when indicated, women's issues.  DH enjoys it at times but you can't compete with March madness.
Wonderful characters and interesting stories, love the time period. I loved Seasons 1 and 2, and loving 3.. Highly recommend
Really love this show!  I get so caught up in the characters, I hate when the hour is up.  I can't wait to watch the rest.
I really liked it.  I can't wait to watch the next series.  I would recommend this TV series to everyone that enjoys a good clean story.

I have immersed myself in three seasons of this beautifully written series. I will be sad when I finish with season four. I was swept away with the music, the scenery and the acting. I feel as if these people are my neighbors, and how I wish I had the delightful postmistress as my friend. I plan on reading the books as soon as I finish the series. I recommend this program to anyone who enjoys a good laugh, or a good cry.

Feeling bereft after the seasons end of Downton Abbey, I turned to Lark Rise to Candleford. It is an investment of time, well spent. While touching on age-old issues normal to family and community, it does so with levity. There are several laugh out loud moments per episode. I look forward to returning to my friends in Lark Rise and Candleford, with each episode.

There are 4 seasons, each with at least 10 episodes. Each episode follows the evolution of the characters in the rural Lark Rise community, and their interactions with the citizens of Candleford. Character development is superb. The viewer becomes totally involved with each one; laughing at their joys; crying with their heartaches.

I highly recommend this series!
Fun well written every character had its own lesson to tell it was human nature at its finest I loved queen

BBC has always been the antithesis of Hollywood in by-passing looks and skin and delving into character.  Lark Rise to Candleford includes 2 locales full of rich characters with individual struggles and foibles.  The story line is anything from boring.  My only criticism is the title of the series is difficult to remember.

This is an excellent serie I loved every minute of it!
The characters and the setting take you to old England

I found the characters real, a little odd, funny, serious, innocent and likable. I start an episode when I am having tea and toast in the morning, gathering up my work related items and getting dressed for work. I find myself watching more than performing the other morning tasks.
My only complaint is the series ended. I certainly would have enjoyed a few more seasons but have followed some of the actors in other period pieces.
This is delightful series that both my husband and I love to watch together! Thank you amazon for making another wholesome, uplifting series available on prime!
Lots of drama, excitment, love intrest.  I hope they can make some more episodes or make another series.  Do not just leave us hanging.
We found the series absolutely delightful.  We loved all the characters, even the bad ones.  We only saw snippets of the program when it first came out and we were delighted with the entire series.
Just love it! They do a great job of growing characters that you don't like into characters that you love. A wonderful small town story.
Such a wholesome show with great lessons learned and entertaining too! It's hard to stop watching - I'm getting through the next season way too fast.

From the very first episode I was hooked.  I truly enjoy just about everything BBC puts out but this series has such a "Realness" about it.  This is how I picture life during this era and in the country; happiness, strife, drama, and triumph throughout the life of the town.  I highly recommend this series to anyone who enjoys peaceful drama and learning life's lessons the old fashioned way!
Very enjoyable series. Nothing vulgar or tawdry. Lots of believable characters in a time when purity was a virtue upheld and people lived by their conscience.

I watched the whole series over a few days while I was sick. Loved it. Can't believe Lydia Bennett (from Pride and Prejudice) is the main character. Really, still can't make the connection in my mind.  She really was both of the characters but I can't seem to see Julia Sawali in either of them.  She must be a great actress!
a show for the whole family ,this is rare in American TV , only the BBC can do it . We love it .
It is about a community and how people grow not just physically, but emotionally.  It is how they all pull together as a community for the best

Full of important truths. Relationships, our interconnectedness  these are the real things; this is what life is about. AND
The writing, acting, scenery, directing, etc. is all very well-done too!
I love this series. I just wish there were more than 4 seasons. I don't have to worry about language or violence when the kids get home and there is 10 minutes left to an episode.
Such a nice series. Each character is so endearing and I love that each episode has a message. I wish it hadn't been cancelled.
This series makes you feel you are part of the population within the small hamlets. Each episode is the beginning of a new adventure or problem. Acting is superb
I love English based shows and this one is well done and family friendly.  I wish I had more time to just sit and watch every episode.

One of my very favorites of all time. I love the sets, costumes, and story's. All dear and refreshing, not like the violence of most of the shows on TV today. I am so tired of all that aggression. No one writes stories like theis any more where people are kind and helpful to eachother. Even when friends make mistakes they are still friends and don't blow eachothers head off with an AK47. We LOVE BBC Programs.

If you like television entertainment in this particular era, then you will absolutely love this series!  A portrayal of love and cultures for both the haves and have-nots are herein provided for your viewing pleasure and education.  When I discovered the series on Amazon and began watching it, I couldn't wait to see the next episode and consequently spend many a late night in front of the television.  LOL!!!  What Fun!!
Without having my Amazon Prime I would not have found Lard Rise to Candleford. It has refreshing, morals and values. Love the characters!
As with most British costume dramas, the attention to historic detail is intertwined with an interesting interaction among its characters.
The characters are engaging and the story lines keep your attention.  I always look forward to watching the next show.
superb acting; after a few episode you feel a part of the community; brings vividly alive a bygone way of life in 19 the century England
What a wonderful show.  Very enjoyable to watch, with great characters.  In a world where television has taken a turn for the very worst, Lark Rise to Candleford brings joy to the heart!
Real life situations and sense of family, my kids can watch it. It's wonderful to see a program like this.
Excellent period drama by the BBC. The story, characters and setting is simply amazing. After one episode I was hooked.
Enjoyed every episoides with their straightforward life lessons. The characters are endearing and believable. The only thing wrong with the series is that it was cancelled
Always intriguing!! The plot and characters are fantastic! Amazon prime makes it so easy to keep watching! I will watch 2+ shows in a setting.
Great entertainment. My wife and I love this show. Great plot and storylines keeps you guessing on every episode. Must watch!

Lark Rise to Candleford is full of real people facing real situations.  It is full of small details of the time - e.g. twisting wet laundry with the help of a stick.  Some characters [especiallly Robert and Twister] sometimes over react.  But such reactions are inevitably resolved in a believable way.  It is not just a fee-good drama; bad things happen, relationships do not aways work.  I have enjoyed it emensely.
This is the most amazing story.  Love the difference between the two towns so close together.  Each character is unique and strong, not one tries to override the other.  I am hooked.
I'm going to be so disappointed when there are no more seasons or episodes to watch...it is "my one weakness!"
Enjoy all the characters and story lines. Watching entire series. Watching with me 10 yr old child, nice family show.
I usually enjoy time period programs.  This is one of the best. I  recommend it and all seasons. Good story.

What a wonderful show with unique characters that make me laugh and stories of conflict and redemption. A beautiful show that I could watch again and again. If you like Downtown Abby - you'll like Lark Rise to Candleford
The characters draw you into their stories from the first performance.  The characters are well cast.  So glad someone recommended this series to us.
I enjoy English period dramas. Lark rise to Candleford does a great job of depicting late 19th century country life. The characters are well done, so that the viewer feels she knows them.
Lark Rise to Candleford continues to delight--what an exceptional series.  Compassionate and at times magical yet never sappy.  Each episode is crafted with the intelligent viewer in mind.

Great series...sad it ended...really enjoyed watching through Amazon.
Would recommend to anyone who enjoys quality shows from the UK. We want more!

Think of the story of the village side of Downton Abbey and that would be comparable to Larkrise and Candleford. This story is set a little earlier, about 1895.  A wonderful cast of characters, beautiful cinematography, and usually a heartwarming story.  This BBC program reminds me a little of a show I grew up with in America, The Walton's.
Quality show and enjoy viewing lives of all people of Larkrise and Candleford throughout the episodes. Good show to watch as a family
love it! Its an up lifting show and you fall in love with the characters. Makes you want to live in a small town :)

With some reservation I give this show 4 stars. We enjoy the well done story and the well developed characters . However, I'm troubled by the witchcraft influence in some characters while the source of godly influence is not evident at all. I have not read the books so I don't know how much is added by the movie makers. I'm curious....
Watching this show is:  "my only weakness"!  All the characters are very endearing, fun fun! So glad they made four series.
I like this show and all the characters how they love one and other threw there hardships and joyful moments.

We thoroughly enjoyed this series.  The stories were heart warming and the acting was superb.  Also, the scenery is beautiful.
This is family entertainment at its best.  Thank you for making this production available.
Great Enlish period piece with the dichotomy of small-town vs. city-life as the anchor for the series. What really makes it is the superb acting, great story lines, and beautiful cinematography!
Very well done expounding late ninteenth century daily life in roual England. The actors and actresses are outstanding especially Brandan Coyle.

Lark Rise To Candleford; even though it took me nearly throughout watching to say the title properly, the experience was like the very first reading the very best of Thomas Hardy!  The fact that these towns were two very separate levels of Victorian society, made it so fascinating. We are more used perhaps, to a broader bridge between the two.  This alone makes the story line all the more endearing & characters more believable.  Once again, Yeah Brit story tellers!
My husband and I love this series. We are going to be sad when we've completed all the seasons. It is a touching, often funny, and beautiful production.
You will not be disappointed with this season.  I have spent more time than normal engrossed in this fine series.

The whole Lark Rise to Candleford series (1-4 that's available) is very enjoyable.  It depicts the life of the British at the time very well and interjects many "everyday life" events that teach good behavior in dealing with societal problems.
My husband and I are watching the Candleford series for the second time and we are enjoying it just as much as the first time.  Great story and great character actors.  Highly recommend.

This show captured me from the very beginning. The show is well written and well acted. I was easily transported back to these days through the people, the scenery, and the way of life. I am sad to know the show only lasted 31/2 seasons.

Such a delightful, sweet, compassionate, genteel series--what a wonderful community this would have been to live in.  Not without trials and tribulations, not without petty grievences, the community sometimes is at odds with one another and sometimes pull together.  The acting is magnificent, the story lovely.
I love this show! It is entertaining and wholesome. Excellent costumes, story line, and acting. I am a sucker for old English dramas, and this one is my favorite.
It is a very nice show and it is not trashy.  Anyone in the family will be comfortable watching it.

The season started off great, but by the end of the season another character disappears with no explanation just like the blacksmith in the first season. At least there should be an effort to try and make things connect from season to season. There were other inconsistencies but I don't want to give too much away. Sometimes it seemed like the writers were rushing it and not taking the time to fully develop the plot as well as with other characters. It's too bad because this show seemed so promising. Since my husband and I enjoyed the first season so much, we will see what season 3 has to offer but it there are any more holes in plot or character development we will have to move on to another show.

This is a wonderful show.  If you are a fan of English shows this one is for you.  It is a peak back in history of the haves and have-nots.  The characters are very well played.  The plot lines are true to life then and now.  I highly recommend this show!!
I think this is a very family oriented show. I love it!  I look forward to seeing it every day.
I love the characters, stories, and the costuming. It was full of comedy, drama, and real-life issues. I definitely recommend it!
I watched the first season and enjoyed it, but am finding that as the storyline builds and you get to know the characters more, it is becoming more enjoyable and addictive to watch with each episode.
Great show that shows people truly loving each other. No sex. No bad language. I'm so upset that there aren't more episodes!
I enjoy the characters, the setting and seeing how different people from town and country survived and interacted. It's the rural Downton Abbey.

This is a delightful series. I Have been enjoying the ups and downs of the various characters
Thomas and Twister are a joy to watch.  I have laughed over the snake episode and the dragon play episode.  I cried over the measles episode.  I am currently watching the last season and will be sad to see it end.

hk

Idyllic English country life set near the end of the 19th century. Endearing characters, tender moments and sometimes unexpected turns make this lovely program a balm to the hectic 21st century soul. I usually binge-watch shows, but find I am trying to draw this one out as long as possible, as only 4 seasons were made! When I grow up, I want to be the postmistress of Candleford ;)
I love series in the old settings. This was great, I hated that it came to an end. I can watch it over and over again

I love this show. i have watched all 4 seasons and wish there were more episodes to watch.
This series is one of my all time favorite show. loved it
I enjoy this return to simpler times in a late 1800's England farming community. I like watching how the community bands together to survive and problem solve.
Fabulous character development in this series. When I finish with each episode I'm anxious for the next one. I am thoroughly enjoying this series.

Can't get enough of it.
I love the story line. Love Laura and Dorcas!
I never know what will happen next .
Each show felt like a vist to Lark Rise and Candleford and was just thw vacation I needed in between work, classes, and home.

I enjoy the series immensely.  When compared to TV and the trash that is on it Lark Rise is truly a breath of fresh air.  Thus far the storylines have been great and the acting superb.  As for me there are no negatives with this show.
this is the very best series ever!  I loved every moment watching it.  I may watch it all over again from beginning to end! super videos!

A bit more complex than Little House on the Prairie, but a family show all the same.  Nice to see Mr. Bates before he went to jail in Downton Abbey.  A cute coming of age story in the English Hamlet of 1895.

I will never tire of this series.  Absolutely family friendly.  So many "family" programs are so dumbed down their unwatchable.  There are many movies out there where if the sex, bad language, and violence were removed, the story is still good, intelligent and full of thoughtful impact or just entertainment.  Lark Rise  to Candleford is proof that the entertainment industry can keep it clean and still be wildly popular.  The producers made a huge mistake by discontinuing this series right at the height of its popularity.  Who does that???  They have yet to "replace" it with anything that is as refreshing and enjoyable to watch.  What a shame.
Such a refreshing change from trashy tv shows! Lark Rise is wholesome entertainment with exceptional acting and delightful storylines! We need more shows like this!!
Season 2 was as fantastic as Season 1...but it also adds a bit of mystery, fantasy, secrets and SCANDAL! I look forward to each episode and love that it will continue to season 3!

I love this show not because it's a captivating insight into England countryside living in times gone by...but because it elevates one to be better.  What other shows do that? Not many these days.

I also adore all the new characters introduced each week.

Is this the most thrilling show on television?  Not at all.  But that's why I love it.  It's clean, slow-paced, and gives a most welcome refuge from most of the trash that television these days has to offer.

Thank you BBC for producing a TV show worth watching.

Very good program. I really enjoy all of the characters and the story lines are well written. I have already highly recommended this to many of my friends and family. They too are enjoying the program.

Just finished watching all four seasons of this wonderful show.  It's one of the best TV series I have ever seen.  Teriffic characters and great actors portraying them.  A different theme and life lesson in each episode.  We have so much to learn from the British when it comes to producing TV shows.

This is a wonderful saga told over time. It is quite entertaining.  The Amazon programs are wonderful, especially when the regular television takes out time of programing for events and runs re-runs over and over. This Lark Rise to Candleford gets better and better.  Always a new issue....
This reminded me of little house on the prairie except British style. I loved the characters and the lessons each episode offered.
Great first class entertainment and I am hooked on the stories. There is wonderful acting, authentic costumes and beautiful setting.
I know it isn't a realistic view of the time, but that might be depressing - this idealized view is fun to watch.  Real life is hard, so I enjoy my little escapes!
Lark Rise to Candleford encompasses the best of British TV.... Charming characters, interesting plots, and clever writing. A great show!
I would watch this season, and all the other seasons of Lark Rise to Candleford, again and again. In fact, that is what I really do. I LOVE this show! I wish there had been many more seasons!
I really enjoy this. Series.  Oh for the simpler life of years gone by.  Folks had little, but they had each other.  Col
This is a great family show. Wonderfully acted with a great cast, setting and costumes. Brendan Coyle (Mr. Bates, Downton Abbey) is terrific as the father of Laura

As with the first season, I again, have thoroughly enjoyed this series.  Each show is interesting and amusing in its depiction of life during the late 1800's.  I find myself looking forward to the next one each day.  It's a nice change from today's blow 'em up, shoot 'em and kill 'em shows that seem to be plaguing today's market.

I loved this series. The costumes and setting were beautiful. I could listen to the various accents all day long with pleasure. The acting was superb.  The feelings shared about life's situations felt real. I began to really care about many of the characters. So I watched every episode happily.  However, some of the story-lines were a little hokey.  And some of the characters were almost cartoonish, although they did develop some as the seasons went on. I agree with one person who said it was a little like "House on the Prairie".  It is something you could watch with children and enjoy.  I was sad to see that they cut it off in the fourth season.
Though not overly complex in it's story lines, it's a wonderful, wholesome show with some very animated characters. Minnie keeps me in stitches.
It's beautifully done! Clean and a wonderful portrayal of days long ago! The clothing and scenery are spectacular. I love the zest of living they show in the stories.

Outstanding character actors. Fun to watch their skill at portraying their characters with such real and unique emotions. Engaging and addicting series that makes you dream what that bygone era must have been like.
I absolutley love this show. To me its a classic that stands right there with The Waltons and Little House on the Praire. It just really good family show. I would recommend to everyone.
Really  enjoyed this series, having watched all the seasons within a week. Kind of a combination of Little House on the Prairie and the Walton's in the English version. Loved all the characters.

I have watched all seasons of LR to C and find it absolutely entertaining. It's much more interest that any of the American TV shows. I wish BBC would produce more seasons of Lark Rise to Candleford. At  present, I am re-watching all of the previous seasons because with their British accents I'm sure I didn't catch all the words the first time around and the wisdom they bandy about is worth catching.
I hope the seasons continue! I look forward to seeing how they all age and become the charters they are meant to be.
Best show ever.  Right up there with Downton Abby and Road To Avonlea.  Great characters, acting and story.  If you like period stories, you will love this one.
I really liked the family love. To see the people work together to make it in hard times. Strong values and respect for each other. I hope to see more stories like this.
It was better than season one. The characters are developing nicely. Plenty of stories to tell. I've already started season 3.
I enjoy all of the major characters in this series.  You have an opportunity to see the different nuances to their personality and how they interact with each other.
I really enjoy British productions.  The characters are all delightful and the stories make me smile and cry.  I hate the word requirements in these reviews.  it makes me not want to review!
Love this series.  I look forward to watching an episode each night.  It is great to have a wholesome family oriented series to view.
I love Lark rise to Candleford. The story is wholesome and family orientated. The scenes seem original.  Makes you want to visit England.
Season 2 was actually better then Season 1.  Great actors and very good story plots for each episode.  I would recommend this show to anyone.
Love this show. Can watch it with my kids and it even gives them a historical basis for much that we learn in school. So good!
Nice getaway from daily life...funny little stories about a quirky community and a meddling Postmistress in the Victorian era....highly recommend.
the best acting. i love each episode. better than watching tv. can't wait to see the next episode. been moved to tears several times.
Great decent values show with no vulgarities, nudity or bad language. Love this and will keep watching and looking for more of this manner.

This is "history" from the other side. I found myself so engrossed in the characters' story lines that I do admit that I sat and binge watched for two days and then I wanted more. Unfortunately, like all good things, it came to an end, but I truly enjoyed it. Several of the characters were ones I developed a fondness of despite their small flaws. A friend and I found ourselves wondering what had happened to Dorcas and Emma and Alfie. Recommended.
Loved all the characters equally. Couldn't have picked any better actors for the characters their portrayed.  It was funny, suspenseful, just waiting or more.
Intelligent characters, clean and humorous story lines relevant to life today. Heartwarming and thoroughly enjoyable. A stellar cast with lovely scenery.
This is one of the best series I have ever seen. Informative and interesting. The casting is superb. I highly recommend it for all ages.

Beautiful series! The innocence of it is so refreshing amongst all the oversexed tv shows that saturate tv today. Interesting story line and the characters were well acted. My only hang up is (that's not anyone's fault) which keeps me from making this 5 stars is I wish Laura was a bit stronger. She's was a bit too weepy for me especially since she's one of the main heroines. Other than that excellent series and there should be more like it.

Aside from the thinly veiled humanistic theology that is juxtaposed as good against the confused religious fervor of Thomas.  This series seeks to deal with the issues of the human heart that each generation must.  It does portray whether intentionally or not that a moral culture can by choosing God's goodness overcome the evil that can so easily emerge in selfish living.  Something that our culture has nearly lost track of and desperately needs such reminders from History.  For this reason I highly recommend this series that we might look into the mirror of our souls and find selfless sacrifice and the excellence of it's reward.
Wonderful weave of personalities in the two towns! Following the lives of the towns people reflects a glimpse of what life might have been in that time period.

I love everything about this show, from the superb acting to the beautiful setting.  Although it takes place in another century and another country, I find the story easy to relate to.  The themes of love and loss, coming of age and aging, and tradition versus progress are universal and timeless.  I watch an episode of this series several times a week, and have seen most episodes 4 or 5 times.  I never get tired of watching them because it is such an enjoyable viewing experience.  I highly recommend this series.

I don't know about many of you, but I get so bored with the traditional tv stories that are portrayed.  Every show that I watch seems to have betrayal, murder, theft, affairs, and so forth.  It gets boring.  This show is different.

The stories from this show surround simple problems that need simple answers.  I enjoyed the sense of community the show had and most of its characters.  It reminded me of watch Little House on the Prairie when I was growing up.

If you are looking for a show with sex, drugs and lots of action, then this is not the show for you.  If you are looking to grab a cup of tea, settle down for the night and find good people working together with good strong values, this is the show for you.
Started watching this show due to Brendan Coyle, as I really like him on Downton Abbey.  I enjoy English TV, and this is an excellent example of one of their better series.
If you like British drama, you'll enjoy this. The acting is excellent and the story lines are compelling. I didn't want it to end.
This is a great family show.  It was a hidden gem.  We are enjoying the show and the characters. There is lots of wisdom from the characters.
Not enough episodes!! LOVE every minute of this show. Cant get enough of it. Watch it over and over! Family Entertainment
Dificult at times for me to follow the storyline. The only character I can associate with is Brendan Doyle, since I have been watching him on Downton Abbey.
Love this show!  It is just a nice feel good program. I would suggest you wait sto start it on a day when you can binge watch because it hooks you in.

I am watching this series for the second time, and I am glad I found it on Amazon.  I love the characters, especially Dorcas and Queenie, both of whom are strong, intelligent women who know how to get their way.  It is also interesting to see the contrast between Lark Rise and the wealthier, more progressive Candleford.  I love the period costumes, especially the clothes Dorcas wears.  Ruby and Pearl are also interesting sisters, and it is fun to see Ruby learning to step out of Pearl's shadow.  This is an excellent series, totally inoffensive for younger views, and most entertaining for mature audiences.  Without preaching, it also is a study in what is moral and what is not.
The series transforms the watcher back to this period in time beautifully. Acting very good. Characters real. Lessons excellent. Excellent series.
Wonderful  show with heart-warming characters......very fine writing, directing and acting....I am only in the second season but I can't wait until the next episode....the BBC knows what it is doing!
Loved this show! It has great character development and a lovely store. If you like this time period I would highly recommend this show.
Absolutely delightful.  Loved each session in the series.  Hope to see more.  Learned a lot about the times, dress, and problems facing the families.
Wonderful, suspenseful and entertaining. Great for the family with intriguing story lines. However, it won't be enjoyable for those who like trashy words and filthy scenes.
Well acted clean family fun. Great fun to watch with your children. Strong female characters. Good for teenage girls especially.

Loved the cast, most well known. The characters were so well played, they were all such warm stories told.
Ever story was just as good as the last. Loved it.
The program is fun to watch because of the language and dress of the times. It also shows the class system in England during those times.
This is a good and clean series that my husband and I have enjoyed. It was slow starting out, but got much better.

This is a wonderful show.  No crime scene investigations.  No snarky twenty and thirty somethings slinging pithy insults at each other.  If you're tired of all the junk on American T.V. drama, then just come over to Lark Rise to Candleford, which has engaging actors and engaging scripts.  Wonderful productions values.  Truly enjoyable.

We are sorry that the series was cancelled it could have gone on forever as far as we are concerned.  Such a pleasure to sit and get absorbed into the lives of the characters.  We will watch it again and again.

We thoroughly enjoy the characters and most of the story lines. Thomas Brown, Margaret Ellison and Laura are favorites. looking forward to finding more shows featuring Mark Heap. Hoping that the Roku reboot we did yesterday will allow us to download more successfully from AP.
On to season 3......

An ensemble cast depicting with humor, gentleness, goodness and authenticity the importance of relationship and dependence on one another during simpler but also harsher times in the countryside of England. What a refreshing series that one can watch without the presence of gratuitous & unnecessary foul language, violence & sex.
Same as season one; simply the best T.V. program my wife and I have ever seen!  Best acting, best actors, best story, best characters, etc., etc., etc.
This is a very entertaining story of people's lives with nuggets of wonderful advice for good upstanding living. The characters are marvelous!
It was enjoyable from the beginning episode.  I liked the contrast between the two towns, the colorful characters and the positive outlook on life of many of the people portrayed.
Superb acting and meaningful, insightful stories with characters ( both main & supporting) that touch your heart.  I wonder how close the videos are to the actual books......

Using some of the same stars out of Downton Abbey, Lark Rise to Candleford will be almost as enjoyable and exciting.  You'll find yourself anxious for the next hour and the next, etc..  Enjoyable family entertainment.

This video continues to amaze me. The acting is superb, the scenery is beautiful, and the settings are incredible. I also love the honesty of the stories,the pictures and the sets. A true flavor of life during that time. I just don't want the series to end.

Enjoyed it very much. I would recommend this series to women. It isn't the type that men would enjoy. No blood & guts. Girls would like it too. Good clean entertainment. No cussing which I appreciate. Loved it.
Season Two is even better than Season One.  I was sorry to see Silla pass, though.  The writing is excellent and the characters are developing brilliantly.

The acting is fine and the stories teach us life lessons within a time past. Human nature is still human nature in all times of struggle. The lead actress and most of the characters are endearing enough for the viewer to want to continue hearing their stories.
I really like this show.  Good family environment.  Some of the shows now days are a bad influence on children.

I love this show. I stumbled across it thru Amazon Prime Video, and fell in love with it. When you watch each episode, it made me feel like I was there in Lark Rise and Candleford. Too bad they are not making anymore episodes. Very well put together show. All of the actors were so refreshing to watch and I learned alot about life, friendships, relationships and etc.....
This season is just as delightful as the last one.  There are a few new characters that will quickly make their way into your heart.

I really enjoy learning history through story telling.  This series reminds me of Little House on the Prairie and how much the family enjoyed reading the books and watching the series.  I like this series because the stories are told well and the costumes are quite well done.  I think it is very much about how my Great Grandmother experienced life in her countryside home during this time period.  I did not know her as she was gone by the time I came along and my family had immigrated to another country.  She was the school teacher in the region.

Great colors, story lines, acting, vocabulary, costumes and actors.  I wish this series went in forever, one of the finest on TV.

.
I accidentally discovered this series and find it first-rate!! I eagerly look forward to every episode. I savor them as a special treat!  Wish they were still making epidsodes!!

I just found the BBC mini series, Lark Rise to Candleford. It is an excellent story of two communities, one in the country and on the city, yet the people's stories ring true, as folks travel back and forth. They have caught my heart and teach true principles of kindness, respect, hard work, forgiveness, charity. Dorcas seems to be not only the Post Mistress but the local confidant yet has her own trials of the heart. Young Laura has so much to learn as she leaves Lark Rise to begin her service as a Postal Carrier in Candleford. Good family entertainment. A must see for those who want great acting that stirs feelings of the heart and brings memories of life and learning.

I like this series, but will give families this bit of info.  Although there is no bad language (that I have heard yet) or nudity, if you are concerned about morality you may give this consideration.  In season 2 we find out that one character has been living 40 years with her man and they decide to make it legal.  Also, a business owner is found to have had a "past", and another business owner is tempted into an affair that is rejected finally because of the threat of being found out.  These things may not bother some, but then again it may others.  Depending on the age of children watching this, one could use these things to teach some life lessons.  Some may want to avoid because of these things.
I found nothing objectionable in the first season -- but then, maybe it went over my head....
I have almost completed Season 2 and am completely hooked!  It is so easy to follow these characters and their comings and goings.  It's been a great reason to be snowed in!
Very entertaining, good clean script with lots of twists and turns and good life lessons without being preachy!  Watch it!

For those of us who LOVE Downton Abbey this series is a MUST! There's Brendan Coyle aka "Mr. Bates " as Robert Timmons and also actresses we remember from " Pride and Prejudice"--remember wild Lydia?! She now plays Dorcas Lane , proprietor of the Candleford Post Office; an AMAZING character in the storyline! Again, this is a MUST SEE and DON'T MISS!

We are always looking for a good period drama to fill the TV viewing space.  The thing we are avoiding is all self congratulatory "awards shows", gratuitous murder and mayhem, blood and gore horror, insipid sit-coms, vacuous talk shows, and anything spewed as reality TV.  Good Lord this is refreshing, not to mention entertaining!

I love this show....I watch it every day...only time I stop is when I need to charge my kindle
I love the characters....all of their ups and downs....the way they live..be it either rich or
Poor...I laugh with them..cry with them...it is one of the best shows I have watched in a long
Time....I am sad it will be over for me soon...I may have to watch it over again..it's that good

A joy to watch. Life lessons in every episode. Only thing that bothers me is that Lark Rise and Candleford started out as a bit less than 8 miles apart and soon seem to become a hop skip and a jump apart.
I love the stories set in different periods of history so have enjoyed watching this programs. Looking forward to viewing the next season

the character are easy to identified yourself with since they are imperfect and down to earth. I love the different stories in each episode and the music. The fist season was better. Season two was a little slower towards the end it got more interesting but over all it is a great series. I am on season 3 and you get so familiar with the characters you get to dislike them in one episode and then love them in another. It shows the true character of human nature.
to me it had everything that life gives you so sad its not on anymore ,must see for anybody that likes great TV
This was a very good series, I enjoyed it very much.  It really brings you into that time period of England.
Best-in-class British series. As good as it gets.  Lots of heart, beautifully shot, terrific ensemble acting.  All four seasons worthwhile.

I just love British television and Lark RIse to Candleford is so wholesome and family friendly that it is so hard to stop watching these episodes.  I wish that this show was still running. Julian Fellowes had Brendan Coyle chosen for the part of Mr. Bates in Downton Abbey when he saw him perform in Lark Rise. Please keep these wonderful shows coming.

It is Britain's version of "Little House on the Prairie" with better scripts and actors.  I recommend this show to anyone who loves Doughton Abbey.  If you love Brendan Coyle (Mr Bates) you will really like this series.  If you are fan of "Absolutely Fabulous" Julia Sawalha (Saffy) is the lead in this series as Dorcas Lane the manager of the post office and town authority.

Good to go back in history of the series and fill in the blanks for the latecomer.  Answers some of the more current series' occurrences and fills out the characters in seeing from whence they've come .... either way I enjoy watching the previous seasons while I await a new season of viewing.
The characters, the writing ,story line scenery are  outstanding. I look forward to every episode . Also the acting is great.
This is my one weakness. Cute little show. Almost the opposite of downton Abbey. Following the lives of small town postal workers. Great acting.
Well done series. I looked forward to it every week on RSU but they changed the lineup and I can't find it, so I'm going to watch my DVD's.

This is a very enjoyable series, reminiscent of Little House on the Prairie but with all the English expressions and history of that time--when railroads were new and small towns were really really small villages and hamlets.  Good acting by terrific actors.

This Series is delightful.  The  characters have depth and interest.  They are not all beautiful like so many of our American series characters are.  It is refreshing to watch and get involved with the lives of the people in Lark Rise.
As time moves on, so do the villagers, discovering more about themselves as they build or ruin their relationships. Excellent!
Great story! I enjoyed the show quite a bit. Good acting by a great cast.  That is all I have to say.

More of the characters are presented in depth and the stories are real and interesting. Acting and production are excellent and the cinematography is rich with the feeling of great landscape artists. Well worth your time.
This is one of the best series I've watched....it's right up ther with Downton Abby!....I couldn't stop!...so sad it's discontinued !

What could have been one of the best shows I ever watched was ruined by the fact that the devout Christians in the show were portrayed as neurotic fools.  And that the "old pagan belief's", as Dorcas called them, were portrayed as more sane and compassionate.  One episode had a ghost, that once was given a proper burial, was "released" to finally go home to eternal rest.  Another episode had the villagers believing that a tree was bleeding human blood because a woman had died and had become the tree - and the only way to "release" her was to perform some ritual consisting of herbs and chants.  And appearing throughout the show, Queenie, an older village woman of Lark Rise, reads tea leaves and accurately predicts the future.  And the Christians, when they react negatively to all this are laughed at or at best treated like they are overreacting.  Conclusion?.......it is respectable to believe that dead people turn into trees and tea leaves know the future, but to believe wholeheartedly that the Bible is God's sacred and inerrant word and is to be obeyed, is foolishness.  Granted, pagan beliefs were and are a part of people's lives, but to portray those as sane and the Christian belief as foolish - therein is the problem.
I have really enjoyed watching this series.  I like being entertained without being stressed out or depressed.  The writing is very good.

I am currently on the last season of Lark Rise to Candleford and feel sad that it's the last.  I will miss the people of Lark Rise and Candleford.  This show has the same feeling of sweetness and morality that "Little House on the Prairie" and "The Walton's" had so long ago.
The characters are sweet and funny. I enjoy watching their growth as people. Smartly written series. I really enjoy seeing how the two communities are so intertwined in their futures.

Think Little House on the Prairie, Avonlea, Dr. Quinn, and you'll get the feel for Lark Rise. It takes you back to a simpler time with a good moral lesson at the end of each episode. It's the story of two towns, Lark Rise and Candleford, country and town, and the people who inhabit them. Central to the story is Laura, a young woman who leaves her family in Lark Rise to take a position with her mother's cousin, the Post Mistress of Candleford. As people travel to and from each place, we see the interaction of families and friends, the deep history of their connections and the changing times. You will find the characters endearing and familiar. I recognized many of the actors from other shows like Cranford and Downton Abbey. It's like spending time with old friends.

I adore history, but don't always love the explicit material that is sometimes included in historical television and movies.  This series is full of beautiful costumes, great acting, and is filled with wonderful and interesting stories, told at a nice slow pace.  Best of all, the characters seem sensible and of a high moral character, and it does not seem to gloss over questions of morality as the characters are faced with them, nor to put a modern spin on what people of the day would see or feel given their situation.  I love the gorgeous colors and shots of the countryside and the historical props that feel completely natural in their placement.  Very convincing and well-written.  I also love the inclusion of historical music -- music that is actually accurate in both its selection and its execution, very well researched and performed in a manner so very true to the characters being portrayed.  Because the series deals with some adult topics, I would probably not watch it with my young children, but because it deals with these topics in such a respectful manner, I would not object to my 10-year-old watching it with me if he was so inclined.  All in all, I find the series to be very believable, and nearly as much pleasure as reading a good old book.  I may just seek out the original books on which this series is based once I finish watching it.

Season 2 continues to be as well written and executed as the first season and, if anything, seems to deepen the characters and make them more three-dimensional as the season progresses.  It is very similar to season 1 and I am very satisfied with the plot progression.  Bravo!

I'm enjoying the Lark Rise serial, now on series 2. The characters are sufficiently quirky to be fun, flawed enough for a bit of tension between them and as likeable or as annoying as real people. The plot lines are generally tidy and if anything, a little too sweet with the real struggles of poverty and of personal shortcomings glossed over a bit with most everything coming out well in the end. I'm not saying there isn't heartbreak or temptation for the characters, but by and large they find their way handily. Though part of the continuing story, each episode is self-contained. Lark Rise and Candleford are pleasant places to visit with gentle people who are, after all, just trying to love and be loved.

I love most everything the BBC airs, but this is by far one of my favorites.  I love this time period, even though it is sometimes a dark time and can be a dreary and cruel time in history.  But Lark Rise to Candleford isn't just about the whims of the rich and woes of the poor.  It's about families and two communities, lower and upper class, supporting each other in times of tragedy and happiness. When they make mistakes, they care enough about one another to be humble and admit them in hopes of avoiding someone else falling into the same peril.  I also love the fact that there is no vulgarity in the contents.  It is a clean family series that boasts of strong morals and values.

Spending an hour with the residents of these hamlets is a lovely, comforting way to end the day.

Just Love Love this series!!! Warm and wish it had continue on  to see how they all went through there lives!!

Very entertaining.the story lines are very hoog.. Sad ,funny, and relevent. So glad there are 4 seasons. A wonderful cast.

Each episode made me feel like I was glimpsing into heaven.  The characters portrayed a sense of family, responsibility and community that doesn't seem to exist as much today.  I would highly recommend the entire series to anyone looking for wholesome entertainment.

I must say I really got hooked on this series. The characters are so good .When I thought there was only 2 seasons I was sad. Surprise I found 3 and 4 . You were not left hanging but oh so glad things ended up better than after season 2..
I've had a wonderful time watching these characters develop and unfold in front of my eyes. This is great entertainment!
I love this series so dissappointed it has been discontinued. I love everything about it. I became attached to the characters

If you loved season 1 then you will love season 2 as well. The lives of the people of Candleford and Lark Rise continue to entertain. I love the simplicity of their lives and the caring they have for one another. Life lessons always abound!
I really enjoy this program. Old fashioned values and I just enjoy this time period. I like the beginnings of women's independence but in a nice, reasonable way.
The series is like a fine wine or a good book.  The character development is outstanding.  It is great to watch a program that is family friendly.  It appeals to the good in each of us.
Engaging storyline, good acting, and attention to detail give one a sketch of middle class England in this period piece.

The charm of the characters and the beauty of the English countryside make this show a delight to watch.  I've spent hours getting to know everyone and I'm sad the BBC has not continued the series but just as we learn in the final chapters of the series, change is certain so even Lark Rise to Candleford had to make way for other BBC opportunites.
Great stories, compelling dialogue, and wit aplenty!  This was highly entertaining and great old-school entertainment. I would recommend it to anyone I know.

This series was so well done. I was very sad that it ended abruptly. If you enjoy historical costume series, you'll appreciate this look into this hamlet and village and watch the progression of history and technology.

Another great series from across the pond! Quality work-love it
Great stories about a small town and the relationships between the people who live there.
Set in a time when long dresses and modesty was high fashion.  Great characters with a comical yet serious story.
Another excellent series from the BBC. The characters continue to emerge throughout each episode and series. The cast of course is perfect in bringing the story line to life. Very addicting show.
We are enjoying Lark Rise to Candleford.  It isn't gripping or thrilling, but it is engaging enough.  The characters are definitely changing.
My wife and niece love it, that's enough for me. It's a great period masterpiece, that only the English can master.
Well written,beautifully acted and filmed. A level or two above most American television series. You will not be disappointed. This is a class act.

I really enjoyed this series.  It was clean, no violence and enough drama.  I stayed on the edge of my seats waiting to see what happens next.

5 stars to the cast and especially Dorcas.  This name is very special to me on so many levels.  Great job to all!  My hope to see a 5th series someday.

This four season series is great if you are a lover of British film. The casting is excellent with several actors which have been seen in other productions. We have watched this series more than once. Very easy to remain interested and easy to follow.
It can be hard to find programs that I am comfortable watching with my entire family. This has been a delightful series.
I am so happy to be able to catch-up on back shows that I missed. This is my favorite BBC production.  I will truly miss seeing more epicodes.
