I often tell people that they could enjoy watching this series with the sound turned off: every frame is a great pleasure for the eyes. The costuming, the scenes, composition, etc. are all works of art.
People are real - character development is great, we get to see the characters in their entirety, warts and all. People have principles, which they endeavor to live by, but they are human. They make mistakes, but often actually learn from those mistakes.

I have enjoyed watching this series by BBC. The characters are richly developed and depict life in a small village in old England as I would have imagined it to be. Reminds me of another British series with Judi Dench as one of the main characters about a small English village.
The second season adds depth to the well established characters of this hamlet. It is very easily interactive as it follows time honored themes that are easily to relate to .
love the costumes and story lines.  Interesting mini series.  interesting women rolls in this time frame.  be sure to see all episodes.
How did I miss this series when it was first run?  Every episode is like a 1-hour vacation, beautiful scenery, charming people, moving stories that often surprise you.  Can't wait for more!
I started watching this by myself.  About one third of the way into the first season my husband started watching with me.  He got hooked too.  We were sad when it ended.
I stumbled across season one and fell in love with this series. Great characters and stories.  I am on season 3 now and have season 4 ready to go. Hope there are more!

Good interesting story, interaction, and insight to living in that era of time in England.
Appreciate basically decent moral mode of show, no explicit sex, swearing or violence.
Lark Rise to Candleford just keeps getting better.  Great acting and great themes with life lessons for all thinking people.
I like to see what life was like in the early years.  I love the costumes.  The subject matter is great.  I also love that a young girl is writing in a journal, you don't see that much anymore..

I do mean hooked.  I don't ever want it to end.
You can't help but fall in love with the
characters and feel for their trials and issues.
Characters are well developed with
layers of their selves revealed more and
more with each episode.
I have loved every episode of this show.  Each has a meaningful message.  Takes us back to a simpler time.

Lark Rise to Candleford is a wonderful show for all. We love this little series and wish that more were made for their higher quality show-ability! Well done and why can't more shows like these be made for family entertainment.
I absolutely loved the characters and the situations.  It was especially nice not to have much blood and gore.  The scenery and costuming were wonderful.
Each Episode was a delight from start to finish.  One begins to look forward to each episode as one enjoys the company of dear friends.

I'm a big BBC fan.  I'm also an avid reader and though I'm not "old," I love Masterpiece Theater and the older BBC shows like Midsomer Murders that have quality story lines minus all the graphic carnage.  I love series like Sherlock Holmes, Luther, Downton Abbey, and Whitechapel (which can be a bit graphic but it's definitely for the "thinking" person).  Something about the Brits; they can make quality television for intelligent people that many US networks cannot seem to do (with the exception of The Killing, most American shows are just over the top, and mindless, with an attitude of, "how much can I shock you or put graphic gore or sex into each new episode?").  Graphic gore and sex does not make for a quality show; good writing and acting does.  If you love Dickens, Austen, and other British authors, you will love Lark Rise to Candleford. Or, if you just like good-hearted, positive stories that make you feel better about yourself and life in general, you'll appreciate the show. The characters are endearing and each episode actually helps you put faith back into humanity (does American Horror Story do that, or, does it do just the opposite?) In any case, this is a gem of a show.  I only wish they had made more episodes.  Once again the BBC does it right!
Most of the time when the series gets older it starts to lose it's luster but not this series it gets better!
I was sorry that the squire was only in the first season, because I liked his character.  The new maid is rather annoying, and I'm not fond of adding the kid Sydney.  Still it is a great series.
Beautifully done. Great costumes. Well acted. Exteriors are wonderfully filmed. Characters are well written and acted. I enjoyed the entire series.
A little like a British version of  "Little House on the Prairie".  I wish there were more than 4 seasons available.
I don't know when I've enjoyed a series more. Hats off to Queenie, Emma and Dorcas, my favorite characters, although that rascal, Twister gets in there, too!!

It is lovely to be able watch a show that does not assault my sense of decency.  It is gentle and humorous.  The characters are well-drawn and delightful.  Thank you BBC for producing something that you would never see in the USA.
I love the show and the characters in the story.  The costuming is magnificent.  Wish there were more shows like this - family oriented, no bad language, and lots of wisdom to glean!
We love this series!  When we finish watching one episode we want to immediately watch the next one.  Very addicting show!

I enjoy the lightness of the series, no gore, twisted psychos, just a feel good family friendly series you can all watch together.  The characters each have their own unique substance to them and I thoroughly enjoy each "visit"!  A British turn of the century version plot reminiscint of The Walton's/Little House on the Prairie.
I just love Lark Rse to Candleford.  It makes me realize how blessed we are in some things and how we've made ourselves too busy with minor things.
I recommend this series for everyone - all ages. There is no bad language and the characters are interesting, real and humorous. Love the British accents, too.
Very well done period series, with wonderful characters and always differing and interesting story lines. The attention to details in homes, countryside, and attire is impressive
The actors really bring this series to life.  The setting is beautiful, and one feels transported to an earlier time when watching.

I bought the first season in a big box store.  After just a few episodes I came to Amazon and bought seasons 2-4.  The characters are loveable and entertaining.  This series can be enjoyed by the whole family.

Love this series.  The story lines, the characters, the background music, the acting are very gentle, relaxing and entertaining. Wish there was more of this on TV instead of all the graphic sex and violence and just plain stupidity that characterizes most of American TV.
Best series I've seen I a long time!  Live the characters, the setting but especially the family wholesomeness that the series portrays!  Would highly recommend!
I really enjoy the British drama series.  They have such good story lines and you can really get absorbed into each episode.
This is just another in a long series of wonderfully written, acted, directed, and produced British period programs. I loved it!
I enjoyed the show very much. I liked all the characters and the time period in which the show was set.

The characters in this show are so easy to connect with. I start out telling myself I will only watch one episode but I can't stop at just one. Sometimes the episodes are funny and sometimes they are sad but no matter the situation in each episode you can relate it something going on in the world today or even in your own life.
A side of life in early rural England that the characters if Downton Abbey never saw! I enjoyed all four seasons.
This is a wonderful story.  Character driven plots, moral.  Our family loves it.  Less drama and not as over-the-top as Downton Abbey, but just as good.

If  you like Downton Abby or Mr. Selfridge then you will love Lark Rise to Candleford.  I stumbled onto it at Amazon Prime and am now trying to get through four seasons!  If you like period dramas you will love this show!
This Show is a Historical Fiction, late 1800 to Early 1900's  that is Clean, wholesome, romantic and even funny at times.  I am hooked

I watched the first episode of Season 1 a couple years ago and couldn't seem to get into it. But over the long Thanksgiving holiday, it was something I seemed to be in the mood for. By the 3rd episode I was really enjoying it. Managed to get through the first two seasons during the holidays. Have since watched Season 3 and plan to watch the final season over Christmas. I'll miss it when it's over. I have to confess I'm a little bit in "love" with Laura (what beautiful eyes!). But I love watching Minnie as well - she's such fun. Lots of great characters and good story lines. It's lightweight fare for when you want something relaxing to watch.
Loved it  - every moment!  Can't wait to seeing the remaining seasons! I feel like I am living in Lark Rise!

I really enjoyed Lark Rise. I found myself working through my day to get another episode in. I of course liked "the other guy" more. And missed the character that disappeared (to make Downton Abbey?)
It was a great show. I wish there was more.

It is with excitement, that I await turning on my Kindle Fire to watch each episode of Lark Rise to Candelford.  I have been engrossed in the goings-on of each character in this show since the very first show.  I feel a kinship to most of them.  At times, I feel as though,  I actually live in either of the two places.

So as you can see, everyone of the actors in this series has done an outstanding job.  The writers, producers, directors and all of the crew deserve high praise for all of their efforts.  We need more shows like this to enjoy.

Wonderful Characters, stories, interpersonal relationships, scenery, costumes. Varied characters and conflicts, but all showing respect and love. None of the gratuitous sex and violence so prevalent in too many of today's films.

As with most Masterpiece movies this one draws you in..the viewer is transported to another era and submerged in the life of the townspeople of both Lark Rise and Candleford.  Beautifully authentic and indulgent.
Loved Lark Rise to Cnadleford Season 2 .  I watch it over and over.  The characters are great.  They  are like  family. Such clean  fun.

I have never enjoyed a video series more than this one, because it is clean everyday life in a small English village. The life and troubles are so fascinating, the folks are so funny and their humor keeps me in stitches. I don't know of anyone who wouldn't enjoy it.
Haven't watched the last episode yet.  I don't want it to end!  Loved all the characters and the scenery and the very different story line.

This spectacular series is not to be missed.  If you enjoy Downton Abby I feel you will love Lark Rise to Candelford! The quality of writing and acting is unsurpassed as you  become involved in a community of people whose lives are intimately entwined. The beauty of the sets, the character portrayal, and this charming story line will turn the experience into an on-screen 'page turner' .
Don't miss it!
Entertaining, great characters and no profanity or nuity.  We watch the series on Amazon so we can see it whenever we have time.
I love the scenery, charming characters, and lack of violent bloodshed. It's a soothing, relaxing experience. All the Masterpiece Theater series seem to be addictive.

This is a very clean show that has a wonderful story line, hilarious yet endearing characters, and lots of great drama!  My wife and I love this show, and we wouldn't feel even slightly sqeamish about showing it to our family because its so squeaky clean! (We have high standards that way because we're LDS)

I love this series.  The characters are charming and brilliantly acted and the period details are delightful.  Lark Rise to Candleford is one of my favorite BBC/PBS series.  I wish it had never ended.

I like the development of each character and the introduction of new people that come to work and live in the town. Great family values. How we should treat one another and our neighbors. I love the dilemmas and how they get resolved. Even the romance is subtle and sweet. No need to show everything. It is my guilty pleasure
Sweet, entertaining and funny!  You can't help but love this show and all of the characters. This show is my one weakness :)

I had never hear of this series before but I decided to give it a try since I love BBC productions. The characters in this show are very endearing and story line are excellent. I am so sad now that I have finished all the seasons. I hope they are making more.
Who cannot love this series, got hooked on the first season and have watched the third season with much delight!  It does give you good values of life no matter what century you are living in...
Great costumes and acting. A real trip into a former world. It is often hard to imagine a world where people actually treated and talked to each other in this manner, but they did.
Even through the story winds down a path I would not have chosen,you won't be sorry you gave the series your time.
you get to know and love the characters. There is never a dull moment as you follow their adventures and dramas unfold.

How anyone could watch the first season and not want to continue on with their new "friends" is beyond my understanding. Season 2 brings with it more story and character development, just as it should.
It is well done. The actors are real people not just "the beautiful people". It is moral. A delight to watch.

Love this show so much, but this DVD did NOT WORK on a USA Blue-Ray player (although it was shipped from the USA? Anyways this is not an all region product. I had to return and order a different one (from another seller). Make sure you check the regions on the DVD before buying!
If you like period pieces, this series is very sweet.  Characters are interesting and moving, not to mention fun to watch.  I highly recommend it.

If you love historical pieces like Downton Abbey, you'll love this BBC series (who also stars Brendan Coyle).  The stories are rich and the themes timeless.  This is sort of a grown up Little House On The Prairie for Brits.  Well done!

The characters are vibrant and multifaceted.  Challenges and/or struggles are clearly defined and the acting is superb.  I am viewing this series from the beginning and will continue to the present.  The people are becoming like old friends.
The series grows on you as the folks quietly go on with their lives.  We enjoy watching them.  It's time to give Dorcas a real life.

Love the first season so I started the second season and I'm equally loving it.  Getting ready to watch the third season.  I am so looking forward to finding out what happens to each character's life.  You get so caught up in their lives and begin to think of them as neighbors.  Good sound and streaming.
we love love love this show. it is so great. the writing, the acting, funny touching moving you laugh you cry you never want it to end.
LOVE THE CHARACTERS IN THE STORY AND HATED TO SEE IT END. WISH THAT THERE WERE MORE SHOW IN THIS SERIES

I continue to admire the residences of Candleford and Lark Rise. I have grown to like each one of them and their way of being. I have cried and laugh with them. I feel part of their families. I continue to be impressed with their trials and tribulations as well as their moments of happiness. I would love to see Laura fall in love and get married. I am looking forward to the next season. Kudos to the writers and producers.
This is an excellent family program with fascinating stories and well developed characters, enjoyable to watch over and over again.
I love this series and look forward to each episode.  I've recommended it to my co-workers.  The characters are believable and endearing.

This show is absolutely fantastic!  The writing, acting, and photography are top-notch and meld into a beautiful stew of heart-felt, wonderful plots!  The scene where Robert is approached by his wife, Emma Timmons, about how she will not apologize any more about his views on women is the greatest written and acted scene in the history of filmmaking.
What an enjoyment to watch! A family show at last. Love the characters, the stories, one gets so caught up that it's as if you are living in that time.

What a wonderful series! I had just finished all available episodes of the wonderful "Call the Midwife" and was looking for something else to dive into. This was a great choice -- it centers on a hamlet (Lark Rise) and the neighboring market town (Candleford) in late 1800s rural England. Great characters, interesting explorations of the class divide, love and hate, poverty and riches, togetherness and loneliness, and so much more. Thoroughly entertaining ensemble acting -- I'm already almost through Season 3. Downton Abbey lovers will be pleased to know that Brendan Coyle, who plays Bates in DA, is one of the major characters in this: Robert Timmins.

The character development continues to intrigue us.  We have fallen in love with the people of Lark Rise and Candleford.  Human nature is revealed in both humorous and touching moments.  The story continues to revolve around Laura and Dorcas, although other characters are emphasized and explored in each episode.  We have come to love each and everyone of them in their strengths and weaknesses as we learn more about them through the stories.  I wish there were more series like this one!
I lived it a lot. It was a great show. I really liked it. I would watch it again. Y

The relationship I have with this series is right up there with Downton Abbey - such rich characters set in a time period of extraordinary changes. Continues to keep me enthralled and love the new characters that weave in/out of the main character lives
A series with warm-hearted characters and realistic situations that the characters manage to overcome. I love an historical background and that is done so well by the BBC.
Clean wonderfully uplifting show.  Great for families, no bad language or inappropriate sexual content.  Fun characters and interesting story lines.

Love this series!  Season 2 is great and has a ton of additional character development.  The only question I have is in regards to what happened to many of the secondary characters from the first season.  They appear to have not brought back a few of them, but did not provide a good explanation of why.  It's still worth watching though!
I wish I lived in this simpler time. I love the show. I hope the keep going on with the show.

The stories of the folks in both towns continue, but one needs to suspend  reality a bit  more this season. New characters come and go more frequently, and Dorcus remains the stalwart moral center of the community.

We enjoy watching the series. Too bad there are not more to come. We followed Brendan to Downtown Abbey. As we are in America we given a better insight to British actors and shows. Lewis, Foyle's War and of course Downtown Abbey are also favorites. Tired of US shows same old lines different faces and lot's of computer help makes for boring TV. We stopped cable TV and one year ago and we do not miss it.
Awesome series great characters - too bad they didn't continue it :( You will be sucked into their world Forever
Characters have great depth. Very endearing. You quickly become impassioned with the characters flights and successes. English perfection in every scene.
As with series one this series is uplifting and the characters grow on you and you become vested in the goings on in the hamlet and town.
Love the setting, love the characters, love the events.  The dialogue is so insightful, and the characterizations are very realistically human, both frail and courageous, and silly and profound.

Wonderful series.  Thoroughly enjoying the storyline, the characters are engaging and believable.  The landscape of Lark Rise is beautiful and the towns people are so wonderful.  Dorcas is the glue that holds it all together.  You will love this series.
Wonderful story line & I've grown to love all the Characters. Lark Rise to Candleford is a lovely little hamlet we would all lve to live by.
Love the way there really isn't one main character. Really brings you into each of the lives of the characters.
One of the main characters is the actor who plays the valet in Downton Abbey.  I watched every episode available.

I can't get enough of this show!  I watch one episode every night before going to bed.  I so look forward to this "special treat" every night.  Season one was great and so is season 2!  I am getting ready to start season 3!  Wonderful characters, wonderful scenery, and the story line is great. LOVE IT
Great character building and the story line is refreshing and charming. I do hope the rest of the seasons deliver.

I love this show.  Have seen it so may times that now I use it to fall asleep to.  The background sound track
Is very soothing.
I absolutely LOVE this show! I hate that there are only 4 seasons but I continue to watch them over and over!
I enjoyed this season as well, my only complaint is that it just ended., It wasn't what I had expected but I there was an understanding of how all the relationship would eventually turn out.
I read her books and enjoy the series very much.  Unlike some that are made from books this one stays true to the era.

in Candleford or Lark Rise. I love the depth and sweetness of all the characters. Watching this is like drinking a clean glass of water. It's for anyone who is nauseated by the filth in "entertainment."
This show is so great, but I am sad it ended so soon. Good thing it's based on a book series!

Wish their were more series. I love the stories. I wish they would write more.
Stories are reality, wit,fun, times, sad times. Hard times truly a  great escape from our hard day. Relax and enjoy the stories. You will enjoy them. I wish more producers would make these movies instead of horror or war movies.

Wow! It is rare to have something so well made to reflect upon. The language in this series is articulate and well thought out. The stories are uplifting and reflective. I have thoroughly enjoyed the theme and lessons brought forward in this series. We should be so lucky were we able to present our ideas and speech today as they have been presented in this wonderful uplifting show.
Love this show,so sad for only two seasons. One of those shows that made you feel good, makes you wish for simple times.

and we enjoyed them so much that we got into watching 2 episodes a night.
The characters were real and the story traced the challenges that
faced village life in a beautiful part of England. We actually started with
Season 3 first and then learned that there were 4 seasons and  in some
some ways it was even fun because it explained why thing happened
in Season 3. You will love the characters.
Love stories about how hard it was to live back in the old days.  The clothes are great.  Also a learning experience such as Queens cake, never knew about that.  :)
If you like this time period and style of show/movie, this is a fun show to watch.  Interesting and endearing characters.
I like it. It is not exciting but very slow and relaxing and I like to turn it on while I crochet. :)
The characters in Lark Rise to Candleford are wonderful. They become your friends and just want to know what is going to happen next.  I hope it doesn't end soon.
I am in season three and will be sad when I have finished watching all of the episodes.  I have grown quite fond of the characters.
Great viewing for anyone with a heart!  Great for families, great for singles.  Wonderful writing, dialogue and character development, just a great show all around!

yet with all of life's complications.  My daughter and I treasure each episode and wish there was an inexhaustable supply.  A bit more relatable than Downton Abbey.  Quality programming with no profanity.
Wonderful cast of characters. The acting was excellent and the story lines had some clever ones. We hated to see the series end.

Always love anything written in that period but especially thought the actors were great!
Will recommend this series to friends.
This show was recommended to me by a friend after I told her I liked Downton Abbey. I highly recommend this show!
The stories  are timeless and portrayed beautifully by the actors.  I so enjoy the beautiful photography and depiction of the time and culture.

Each character's portrait blends their unique broken-ness & giftedness as each build & blend their "hamlet".
Alphie, Dorcas , Laura ,Little Man,Minnie  Mr. Bates/ Timmons ,
Queenie & Twister ... Applauding you !
I enjoyed watching all of the seasons of Lark Rise to Candleford. The scenery, historical background and characters were all developed in a way to keep you wanting to find out what was coming next.
I so enjoyed this series.  I was sad to see it end. Great casting and acting. Will definitely watch this one again.
Don't want it to end.loved the characters & personalities. Best entertainment in a ling time. such a mix of funny,  sad, & uplifting. Scenery was great! Watch for sure.
I love the feel and atmosphere of this series. The actors are excellent and this is something the whole family can enjoy.

Lovely, gentle show featuring actors you'll recognize from "Downton Abbey," "Cranford," and A&E's "Pride and Prejudice."

It's a great show to watch in a marathon on a rainy day.
The subsequent seasons of Lark Rise maintained the standard of season one. I enjoyed every single episode and have watched it more than once.  Just a lovely period piece.

Great show, it is really something different than what you usually find on TV. Regardless of the issues there is always a positive message. I would highly recommend this for families or anyone looking for a good feeling show to enjoy. My only complaint is that BBC only made 5 seasons. I think you will come back to watch it like re-runs.
I enjoyed the refreshing and simple life of Lark Rise and Candleford.  A great series to relax by on long evenings.
Great series. In the vein of Downton Abby. Love these English dramas. The writing and acting is far superior to most domestic productions.
Delightful show.  Great actors and storyline. I only wish there were more seasons to watch.  Worth watching, highly recommend any episode.
Great casting, great acting, great location - totally made me homesick for that part of England. It is worth watching over and over.
This is one of the best series that I have watched in a long time , sometimes it is too good , that I find myself staying up to watch just one more episode
It is full of family values and friendship.. I am so glad I found it, I will definitely let others know to watch too... absolutely love it!!!
This is the best series I have ever watched. My whole family enjoyed it so much!! Just finished it tonight / will miss our lark rise nights! Will definitely watch again!!

Larkrise to Candleford is a charming depiction of life a 100+/- years ago in rural England.  The actors do a splendid job, each perfect for his/her role.  This series is what I'd call 'light' viewing yet they do cover some topics such as childhood death from disease.  I have watched the complete series a number of times and am disappointed that they left the viewers hanging on a number of issues.  Perhaps they will have a sequel to give us closure.  If you like period British films, I'd highly recommend this one.
An early 19 th century setting with modern social themes and no character consistency from episode to episode was too much to endure. Basically a period soap opera.

Totally hooked!!!
We are watching multiple episodes at a time. Characters are really good in their respective roles. Most episodes have life lessons applicable to today. Just terrific programming.

This heartwarming series is sheer joy!  The variation of the characters are what makes the series so entertaining.  When I first started to watch the series I was skeptical, not knowing anything about it, but that soon changes when you get to know the characters.  Great good fun enjoyment!
I wish they had more than 4 seasons of this show. This is a great family show. I would recommend it to everyone.
Very entertaining! Romantic!  If u like Classics u will like this one. Very funny at times with the drama of that era.

The character development only improves in this wonderful series and the complex issues engaged are even more relevant--yet without seeming to impose contemporary issues on a previous era.  (See my review of Season 1)

When I reviewed the first season I found it wanting. The second season shows definite improvement though it is slight. Yay!  The story lines are still disconnected from one episode to the next. There is lack of overall coherence. But a kind of underlying cohesion seems to be building up. Dorcas, Robert, Thomas, Laura and the unfortunate Twister have interesting roles. Not to mention Emma and the Pratt sisters. This is an idyllic tale of bygone times which is still interesting to watch. It started off without much of a plan but has slowly acquired some coherence. Perhaps, this will end up as something that was slow off the mark but finished strongly. I hope it does. We will watch all four seasons!
good morals and ideals! I would not hesitate for a young adult or child to watch this series.  Just like Little House on the Prairie, but in BBC fashion.

Each night my wife and I sit down and watch a couple of episodes of Lark Rise to Candleford. We found the first season by accident on the Insp channel and loved it so much we began watching it on Amazon. thanks to my prime membership which allows for free streaming to my laptop.

I love this show for so many reasons...the characters are well thought out (love Mini & Alf), the stories, the family values the community closeness all make for great tv watching.
Enjoyed the day to day interactiion of the people. Their care; concern, and resolution of conflicts is a good example. The development of characters wss quite good through all three seasons.

Set in late  the 1800's England countryside and from the perspective of young "Laura Timmons,"  who moved from her family home in the hamlet of  Lark Rise to the larger town of Candleford,  to work in the post office, this is a delightful series with great characters and more depth than expected.
Wonderful characters that can be a little predictable, but intelligent and funny!  I will be watching this series through to the end.
Can't get enough of this series!  Do wish I could find out what is going on with Sir Timothy and Lady Adelaide, though.
Creating a show that is well-written, interesting, with admirable characters and casting, that is also clean and free of filth is quite an accomplishment!  This show is the best of all of these.

Since I enjoy the PBS British period series, when I found Lark Rise to Candleford: The Complete Season One, I snatched it up, watched it and got hooked.  There is something soothing and uplifting about this show.  Great to watch before bed after a rough day.  Great acting, wonderful settings, fantastic period dress---although I wonder about the Pratt sister's taste in clothes!
Loved this program. Wish it went on longer. Love the characters! Especially seeing how a woman in those days ran a Post Office.

The story lines are compelling and the character development is great. You really get a feel for the period and what people were going thru in England in the late 1800's. But the stories also relate to today and what people deal with in today's society. Unbelievably, there is no nudity or foul language and it's good fare for the whole family - yet very entertaining. :-)

I was not a fan of the first season, but I muscled through to season 2 which was much more exciting! Character development was much better and the relationships seemed much more real rather than scripted. I enjoye the serenity of country life whilst also enjoying the niceties of town. The Pratt sisters and the new characters bring a story that makes the whole of the series that much more enjoyable.

The plot and characters in this series are so artistically and interestingly spun - watching one episode per day just isn't enough!  Instead of one main character that gets all the attention, and so-called action, this is an ensemble of LEAD players.  Dorcas the Postmistress, the Timmons family, the Pratt sisters, Queenie & Twister, Thomas and Margaret, the Arless' s, and all of their neighbors and friends ... each one so human.  And the premise of a small hamlet in England (Lark Rise), interacting with a somewhat larger and more sophisticated village (Candleford), with each episode rich in experiences between the two populations, is unique and entertaining.  AND there is a lesson for today's writers and directors:  the language is clean.  There are no corpses, vampires, filthy expletives, or sexually explicit scenes.  The series, not just season 2, provides an experiences with believable human beings - having a full range of experience and emotions.  I thoroughly enoyed this series, felt uplifted even when the characters met with difficulties, and was so sad when it concluded.  I just wanted to continue watching, and learning, and loving the lives of the people from Lark Rise to Candleford!!
I enjoyed the history and the characters came to life in a way that made me want to find out what was to happen next.

Love it and the characters. The story line is is great and follows the era with ease, very good show.love it and the characters. The story line is is great and follows the era with ease, very good show for the whole family.
Continues to entertain and hold interest.  Shows the difficulties of times passed and folks life styles.  Would recommend as a good change.
I loved the characters and story lines.  The acting was great. I could hardly wait to see what happened in the next episodes. Was sad to see it end.
This is an excellent series. I found myself drawn in quickly. The show features likable characters and meaningful story lines.
I love the country side and the characters are so true to real life.  Wish that this series was more ongoing.
Love it! Just wish that they would find love. I want Laura to be happy and dorcus to forgive and be happy

This is one of those series that work their magic and touch you heart.  Lark Rise is a poor community that lies just outside the more prosperous village of Candleford.  The interactions between the two towns is sometimes poignant, sometimes amusing and sometimes inspiring.  We'll worth the time you spend watching.
Beautifully continues the story of two villages and the interwoven tapestry of the lives of those living in both places.
love this series, tried to watch on TV but episodes kept jumping around so I found on Amazon prime and watch in order. sure was a lot more interesting when I could understand what was going on.
Beautiful costumes and scenery. Great variety of cast, stories, bit of history, etc...Nice switch from today's tv. Sorry that it ended.

Okay, Downton Abbey has substance, but the drama trumps the substance. I love DA, but I prefer Lark Rise because it has caused me to think differently about several things and it is truly, truly beautiful. It's kind of like DA meets Little House on the Prairie, so that is pretty good.

You know you really love something or someone when you tell family, friends and strangers about it!  Lark Rise to Candleford is "My one weakness", as Dorcus Lane would say.  I adore the propriety of speech, the moral convictions with resolution, the portrayal of lives lived happily in different ways, the amazing costumes and the simplicity of this non intrusive BBC program.  I have never felt manipulated, disturbed, depressed or anxiety after viewing an episode.  It is incredibly refreshing, especially with a glass of wine.
My family enjoyed the entire series together. Well done. A good family entertainment. The cast was very well suited to their various parts.
Love history and this is like going back in time machine, seeing how people lived and worked together in those times.
Clean, nice, extremely entertaining and engaging with out all the unneccessary smut that usually accompanies a series. A must-see for folks who loved Cranford.
I really enjoy watching this series, I usually watch episode after episode then wonder where my day has gone to.

It took me a few episodes before I truly got into the season.  I may have given up if the reviews hadn't been so high.
Once I was converted I fell in love with the scenery, story and thought the acting was great. LOVE Minnie!  :)
This series is worth the time watching it, which is not a statement to be made about many tv shows!  The story lines are great, the characters are interesting and fun to follow.  Bring on more!!
I absolutely love this show.  It reminds of a british version of Little House on the Prairie.  I wish there was more quality television provided on American tv like this show.

I love the simplicity of this show. I'm a big fan of British television. I also like that this deals with life without a lot of swearing or atant sex. I can just sit back and enjoy the English countryside.

This is one of the best BBC series yet!!!  My husband and I couldn't get enough of it.  WE watched all 40 episodes in two weeks.  This was a book of virtues.  We will watch it again and again.  I rate I with the A&E version of Pride and Prejudice.
Love the characters and the time period .Wish it would continue .Sad that it has ended. Hope it will return soon.
It is just a joy to watch.  When I need to relax, I choose this to watch.  Family values and fun to watch.
I love the story of the daily lives of folk in this setting, in this era.  I can think of no dislikes. The costumes, buildings, methods of farming, etc., are all just wonderful
I got caught up in this series and loved it. for me, it was over too soon. enjoy. See the other BBC series like Candleford

You learn a lot about people and relationships. Each episode offers stories based on life events and situations.  I've learned more about people, how we react to them and how society dicates reactions to things that happen.

This is just simple stories from a bygone age in English life. A pleasant and enjoyable series which transcend you to another life and time. Pleasant viewing that brings todays fast pace f life to that of a more serene age. Thoroughly enjoyable.
Great period drama with characters I came to love....sorry it's over with season 4! I give it a thumbs up!!
I completely love to relax by watching this series.  I would love to go back to a time in life when families and neighbors cared greatly for each other and respect was the normal.
The show had no bad words or scenes, it was great for the family! The characters were believable and the actors good. Thank you for having such to watch. God bless you!
But then again I'm a bit biased because I love a lot of BBC shows. :) I even got my significant other to watch it!
It is hard to stop watching Lark Rise to Candleford. You will always want to know what will happen to the characters next. There is a strong draw to this program that sucks you in completely.
Escape to another time and place. Each episode brings closer to the well developed characters.this one got five stars from me.
Love the characters as they developed over the four seasons.  Definitely worth watching.  I will miss them now that I have watched all four seasons.

If you are looking for a good movie (feel good story), Lark Rise to Candleford will not disappoint you!!  Wonderful story-line and  good acting leaves you wanting more.  I actually wished the series would never end!!

This review is written by Katie: We like everything about this show.  The characters, the settings, the clothes, the stories.  It is all very well put together and you almost want to live in Lark Rise or Candleford!

I have been watching all the seasons and i love all of them. Queenie & Twister are my favorites along with the post office. I especially like watching Laura and all of the actors that are in this series. i never knew this was on, is it on a series on television?
  Clareece

Most of the same characters as in season one but they add a love interest for Ms. Lane and Laura. Mr. Timmins still drones on about his "pride" to the point that he is vying for least favorite character. The first show of season 2 is unlike any of the others - a kind of ghost story. It is out of form but very good.
This is a wonderful, calming, well-acted drama. So good! I wish there were many more seasons to watch. I wish it was still in production. Perfect for my kindle fire !

charming story line, acceptable for the whole family. I enjoy how the twists and turns always end up
with a positive outcome for everyone.
It's a feel good program with lots of wonderful chapters. You grow to love and look forward to the next chapter.

I enjoyed the first season and also this was a wonderful follow up. Well written, directed, acted. No plot give a ways from me yet I was disappointed to see some actors leave. Keeping it interesting though.

The character development and scripting of this series is really quite fun.  Costuming
is excellent, locational setting is also excellent.  I think if you enjoy British costume drama
you will be sure to enjoy Lark Rise to Candleford.
We've gotten to know the characters and enjoy how they have developed over the second season.  It's a great series.

I love this series.  An English "Little House on the Prarie" sums it up quite well.  The actors do a wonderful job.  This is the second time I've watched the series and I just realized that Dorcas was Lydia in BBC Pride and Predejice.
This is simply good, clean entertainment speaking of a bygone era where life is viewed through the lens of a young woman as she reflects on years gone by.  Don't miss this one.
Wonderful family series!! I highly recommend it.  Get out the popcorn and gather everyone around for some good times together.
A period lovers MUST!  Absolutely love the story lines and the cast of characters.  Love Brendan Coyle in anything I see him in!
A series with good moral story lines and one I do not mind recommending to other friends and family members.

My favorite episode in this season is the one where Ruby screams "Mouse! Mouse! Mouse!" a dozen times while standing on a chair. This is such a great series with wonderful characters. I missed them the day after I finished all four seasons.
I just love British tv.  I love this like I love Downton Abbey.  The characters are interesting and likeable - watching a bunch of decent people - it's refreshing.
I love old England and this show tells how life was back then.  It's my one weakness... As Dorcas Lane says.

You will love the main character in the Post Office, Dorcus. All will enchant you till you can't stop watching. I watched until all hours of the early morning because I couldn't wait to see what would happen.  You will truly love this series.
Character development is a strength in this series.  Good for the whole family to watch together and learn life lessons.
PLEASE FIND A WAY TO BRING BACK MORE EPISODES - I TRULY LOVE THIS SERIES.  MY FAVORITE IN THE WORLD
This serie grows on you. I told myself I'll only see a couple of episodes and ended seeing the whole series. Great acting and scripts.
I loved this series!  Was sad to see it end and will miss spending time with all the residents of Lark Rise and Candleford.
The actors are great and the plot twists and turns.  There is drama and a good bit of humor to balance the story line.
like Everwood but in English:-) just a fun-loving show that makes everyday life seem easy:-) some of Downton Abby actors are in this series

A friend told me about this show, knowing that I am an anglophile.  Don't know how I missed it, but I am so glad he told me about it!  It is interesting to see the way people lived in the past in the countryside in England.  The problems that are dealt with are some times the same as those we have today, and it is amazing how similar the "solutions" are.  I like the camaraderie and caring of and about the different characters.  And, I think the lessons "taught" can have an impact on us.

Great show, a study of relationships and human beings.  How to be at your best even in tough situations.  How we help each other to be the best we can be when a community really works together.  Lovely.  Encouraging.  Uplifting.  Hard times, good times, dealing with crisis and plenty with dignity and compassion. Good show.

This is a most excellent show that gives us a glimpse into how life was in rural England. It is about everyday life and human nature. I love it, it is hard for me not to watch more than one episode at the time.  Just lovely!
So far, not as well-done as last season but still worth watching.  The first show was strange, but it gets better.  Hopefully, the rest will improve as well
It is as good as season one! The characters are endearing and you will rejoice in their victories and mourn at their losses. A clean show foe the whole family to enjoy.
I really enjoyed this season. I couldn't limit myself to one per night as I had planned. A great concept for good storytelling.
Yes, they all had to work hard just to survive back then. But, the simple life has its rewards. Are we better off today...I don't think so. I long for what was but is no longer.

I liked the first season of this show, but then it had purpose and structure.  I find it difficult to care about the characters that take up most of the screen time in this second season so I quite watching it, maybe I'll pick it up in the third season to see if it's any better.
Better than Downton Abby - cinematography was amaizing - makes you yearn for simpler times - so many lessons to live by today  - The "Post Mistress" is my hero...  she is "my only weakness"

best BBC show I ever watched.  writing and acting is superb.  Set in a rural village in the mid-nineteenth century at the very beginning of the industrial transformation.  Recreation of the period and human interest of the plots is amazing.

Why in the world would they just stop filming this great show right in the middle of the excitement?!  It was such a nice escape from the world as it is today.  Even my 8 year old son liked it!  So bummed there's only 4 seasons :o(...
I enjoyed all of Larkrise to Candleford so much that I got my husband hooked as well.  The stories a wonderful, but the characters are even more so.  I would highly recommend Larkrise to Candleford!
I like these kind of shows there just wasen't enough of them. I would like to see more of them.

I enjoyed the characters and their relationships. Young and old alike interacting and helping one another.
Charming and loveable characters.

I love that everyone in this show is really trying to do what's right ,even though they frequently make mistakes.  The scenery is stunning. I can't wait to find out what happens in season 3 to the people of Lark Rise and Candleford.

I have enjoyed every single show! Two of my favorite actor's are Queenie and Twister. But then I really like every actor on this show. From Thomas Brown to Laura, they are all top notch! The story line seems real for that time period where Squire and Ladies were highly respected and loved. At least loved in this show...............

Superb..... cast.... wonderfully done, 5 * * * * *s, it makes my laugh, & cry at time, so will done...
Thank you.
Hope there is more...Looking forward to Season 4

Entertaining in showing healthy values. Leaves you with a warm happy feeling. The featured situations show how a small community can pull together to make every resident feel a part of township family.

I kept coming back for the picture of a simpler life, and found that human frailties abound no matter what the historic period.  Strong performances by the leading actors. My favorite is Minnie. Such a fresh face, such innocence!

Absolutely superb series. The setting for this period in old England is very authentic and believable. Every character is just great and so believable and the acting is first class. Happy stories, sad stories and funny stories. I wish I could go back in time and live amongst these characters.
When you watch this in HD, it's like watching a living painting on your screen. Can watch this over and over and never get tired of it. I only wish the BBC would make more.

This series is a must see.  It far surpassed my expectations.  Each season builds upon the other with wonderful "surprises" that truly touch your heart.  You'll laugh, you'll sigh, you'll relate to one of the characters for sure.
I hope you enjoy watching as much as we have:)

Lark Rise to Candleford is a sweet movie that takes you back in time.  Many of the same characters in this movie were in "Cranford" and "Return to Cranford", which are among of my favorite movies.  I love to watch Dickens, Jane Austen, and Elizabeth Gaskell movies during the holiday season and this will be added to my each and every year choices.
Excellent great quality high class good writing captivating refreshing.the best experience something to really enjoy what you watch fjdhdhdhdhdhdhddh amazon this whole how many word thing is redic.
If you like period pieces, this is great.  Nice and light hearted.  Accurate, well produced.  Suitable for everyone. Wish there were more seasons than 4.
This is a fun period piece. I enjoyed it very much and was very sorry that there were only 4 seasons.
We love it. It's a great family show. You can watch it with family and not have to fast forward it to avoid "over educating" your kids. Keep it up.
Love all the characters.  True acting, I felt I lived there too.  Shows at its best.  Clean, descent and sweet.  Not offensive like what is shown on regular TV now days.
The costumes and set design were very good. The story line was a little sappy. Overall it was very entertaining.
If you're a fan of Downtown Abbey, you'll be a fan of Lark Rise to Candleford!  It's a great story.
Lark Rise to Candleford is interesting, witty, well-played, almost as good as Downtown Abbey. I simply love this series :)
It's a combination of Little House on the Prairie and Anne of Green Gables.  The characters are very diverse and no one character dominates.  Very charming.

Maybe watching these episodes one after the other isn't the best way, but I found season 2 as equally uneven as Season 1. The Pratt sisters seemed to have mellowed and become less catty, but I am finding Robert's self-righteousness boring, Dorcas' sweetness-but-not-all-that-sweet trying, Thomas' religious spouting tedious, Twister's crotchetiness annoying, and a few other characters' idiosyncrasies fast-forwardable. It's well made and produced, but the story-lines are predictable and many uninteresting. And it's sad the way characters come and go like they never existed (no mention of the Squire or game-keeper from season 1, little made of Zilla's passing, etc.)
Another great classic story about the positions in society and how basically we all share similar challenges. Great character development!

This show is well done - it is filled with thought provoking issues of life. The preformances are believable. The characters are pithy and sincere. I love their sense of humor. The historic setting has much appeal - helping us understand times past as well as from where we have come.
Thoroughly enjoyed to watching the first year series.  The second year is excellent as well.  Very solid screen writing and the actors are superb.

This series is refreshing.  No car chases, no steamy love scenes, no blatant sex, no foul language, no violence.  Like I said.  Refreshing.  A charming and delightful story of normal life in a bygone period.
.I love this series and was enveloped by each character.  I was so sad to see it end.  I was shocked that he actor who played Alf has not other credits.
A neighbor recommended this series to me. I've been sick and on bedrest. The series was entertaining and kept me from freaking out being inactive!
If you like BBC TV and British Dramas you will enjoy the interactions of everyday life as depicted here in a couple of neighboring communities.
There is just something about sitting down and watching a wholesome show...and this is why I enjoy this series so much.

This series is well made, superbly acted, and very believable. It captures what most in America have probably only I own as a page in their Highschool history book, the developments in society during the beggining of the end of the British class system. It accomplishes believably, moral lesson, and deep character development seamlessly. I would strongly recommend this to anyone who enjoys legitimate television programming.

All seasons of this series are worth watching.  Start at the beginning and then follow the story line all the way through.  The characters are very human, delightful and charming.  The stories are not complicated but enjoyable and as applicable today in their understanding of human nature.  There is a serious side to the series too--it is set at a time when England was facing huge industrial and technological changes.  You see the struggle in the people and the struggle of the working classes to keep themselves, if they can, out of poverty.  One can identify with all of the characters in this series.  Definitely an enjoyable watch.
Great story lines. Fun to watch.  I was pleasantly surprised.  glad to see good programming still exists. Can't wait to see more episodes.
Loved, loved, loved, this series.  Hated that there was only 4 seasons.  I guess I'll have to read the book.

We enjoy following the plot and appreciate that the actors portray very believable people and situations. Highly recommend for those who enjoy drama and character development without violence and bad language. Character analysis and situations presented lead to beneficial conversation among viewers, if they are interested.

This is a lovely series about the people living in the two towns of Lark Rise and Candleford.  When I first started watching season 1 I thought the story lines were just too simple.  But I've found that the stories are as complex as anything going on today with just the right amount of humor thrown in for good measure.
Each episode has a blatantly didactic bent, which gets old.  The postmistress is a not believable paragon of altruism and faith in  humanity.  Too too perfect.  Bleh.
The story lines and characters all come together in a very engaging manor. My husband and I look so forward to watching this series and will be sad to see it end.
It was awesome. Didn't want it to end. The characters were great. Great testimony for human values and morals. Recommend  it to everyone.

I love how each character is developed.  I love the casting and the story lines.  I love that character, honor and integrity are emphasized in this series.  Makes you think about your life and your choices.  It is a thinking person's show.  Can't say thank you enough for such a good series.  Please, please do more.

First let me say I am no longer "Unhappy with Amazon"  they have solved most of the problem issues I had.
And I thing Lark Rise to Candleford in a great series.
This show is awesome! You really enjoy the characters, and the story lines. I look forward to the next season.

This television show is beautifully acted, scripted, produced, etc.  To my taste, (and I know there are many who would disagree), this is what television should be.  The characters are real, the subject matter honest, and there isn't all of the extraneous violence, language or sexual content that would not add a bit to the storyline.  I am deeply saddened that this series only ran for a short time, as I came to truly love the hamlet of Lark Rise and the town of Candleford.
The costuming and characterization is wonderful.  I only wish there was a little broader plot-line as it seems to repeat some of the same stories.
I'm english by birth and it's so nice to listen to the old country accents.  Wonderful acting by all the cast

Good writing, good acting, perfect costumes and scenery, stories of English hamlet & village life in the late 1800s, told with humor and drama and a little romance.  Wonderfully entertaining for the whole family.

I am so very tired of all of the tv shows that are on the networks these days.  It seems as though they are all either about zombies, forensic science, "It's all about me" reality shows, too much news. I want to watch a show that makes me feel good and reassures me that there is still some good in the world, people who care about each other and are not afraid to show it, and leaves you with a nice fuzzy feeling when it is over.  Lark Rise to Candleford does that in almost every show.  The characters are all well written and each has something different to offer, yet not one overpowers another.  They live their lives in these small communities, and their struggles and problems are worked out in a kind and gentle way.  At least when I watch this show, I can relax and feel the way I wish I felt on a daily basis.  I only wish there were more shows like this being made today.
Love this show, reminds me of a cross between Little House and Downton Abbey.  Love it!  I am sad that it is only 4 seasons...
I enjoyed Season 1 so much, I had to watch season 2! Again, I was amazed. I enjoyed every episode. My only regret is there is not to be a Season 3. What a shame.
Great series.  You fall in love with all characters.  I live the contrast of places.  Best character..Thomas Brown and Margaret.
I love this show!! Wish it was still on!! I enjoy how they show characters in different classes and how they interact.

I love this show.........every episode reveals more and more detail of the characters lives and of the period. Don't miss all these episodes...as Dorcas Lane would tell us.......this is my "one weakness".

It hard for to list all the good things about this series.
Excellent acting, interesting and believable stories.
I also like emphasis on ordinary life rather than the tiffs.

Love watching this series. The cast is great and the voice overs explain the customs of that time period. The story lines can be a little contrived at times but the quick pace and good acting keep you interested.

I thought it was very relaxing to watch. Makes you smile.laugh and cry.
I would like to see more of this show.
This show demonstrates the way people really lived.  It's autobiographical - Laura actually existed, so that makes it even more special.
Enjoyed this time period series. *time period shows are my one weekness*! The characters were easy to like.  My only complaint is that it ended quite abruptly.
A delightful series. Awesome chemistry between the characters and storyline. I was very disappointed the series ended and they did not finish season 4

This program was wonderful. The BBC sure knows how to produce wonderful programming. I could hardly wait to watch each new episode. The acting and storylines and costumes were perfect. 5 stars isn't enough !
LOVE LOVE LOVE this story and how you don't need blow up and curse words to have a simple time good story!
I am loving this series.  Don't know how I missed it before, but I'm watching all the seasons now and savoring it!
this is a no brainer.  Like reading a wonderful literary series.  I could hardly wait for spare time to watch the next episiode.
This is a very good series that kept my interest with each new episode.  Made me feel I was a part of the community.

I would love to give the second season 5 stars, and it was an enjoyable season to watch. My primary issue with season 2 is that in season 1 I loved the little stories told each episode but I also like the larger story of Timothy and Dorcas. The second season does away with a large over-arcing drama and basically has most dramas neatly cleaned up after one episode. I guess I just miss the Timothy and Dorcas story and was sort of miffed to see it go...the biggest shock, I grew to like the Minnie character who just about drove me crazy her first few episodes.
Truly enjoyed this series and watched it up to the 4th but was left hanging.  Wish the TV stations wouldn't do this all the time
We love watching this with the whole family.  It is such a beautiful show!  I am really glad we found it.
I love period dramas and this one is fabulous.  Rich characters, lovely costumes and a host of characters who really keep things interesting

I always have a book to read for down time. Once I started watching Lark Rise it became my substitute book. I felt like I was immersed in their world. The world of Dorcas the postmistress which was very bewitching .

I have watched the entire series, now I miss my friends and long for more. Won't happen. Oh, well. For anyone who wants loveable characters in a period setting with those adorable British accents, this is the real deal. Based upon real life experiences, "Lark Rise to Candleford" rings true. I highly recommend the entire series to everyone.
I really enjoyed the show.  I liked see the history and how that era of people lived in that time period

This series is proof that some situations and solutions are timeless.
I have spent many enjoyable hours watching this series.
the first one in this season is spooky and off base from the rest of the series and I docked 2 stars because of. The rest of the series is fine. Season one is by far the best.
I thought each character was believable and interesting.  Would recommend this series for a gentler, kinder storyline. Sorry the series finally had to end.
Great show Love all the people and the town is so great.  Wish there was more like it on Tv
I enjoy the story line so much......can engage each character so easily and look forward to seeing more!!  thank you! :)
Delightful story, excellent acting, wonderful photography, good character development, it was a joy to watch, sorry it stopped after four seasons

The only problem I have with this season is that there is too much time spent on the love lives (or lack there of) of Laura and Miss Lane and not enough of the little stories about the townsfolk and hamletsfolk as in the previous season.  Also, enough with breaking Miss Lane's heart already.
Loved the show. great scenery and british accents. true to life world. wish there were more shows like it!! great
One major reason I like this series so much is the unbelievable acting from each and every member of the cast.
I love the time period, the costumes, the weekly stories are heartful and humorous.  All the actors are great and look forward to watching the next episode!
I am not through watching it all, but love it.  Love to see what living was like so long ago. Think the stars are great!!
Visually beautiful, good moral values, and each episode gently teaches and illustrates a lesson. I felt like a better person after I watched each episode.
I choose this rating because I really enjoy he characters and the stories in Lark Rise to Candleford. the characters are so heart warming and interesting.
The bbc does and exceptional job with there tv series!  This was one of my favourites. Watched all episodes of this series.  Wish there had been more.

The costumes and sets/locations make it worth watching. The stories are good too. They are based books that are somewhat autobiographical, so you don't get the feeling that the charcters are viewing their world with todays "modern" views.

I would recommend this show as the people are very engaging and it's just plain good TV.  I got very invested in the different people and looked forward to how things were going to turn out for them.  Can't wait to start watching season 3!

Very good. I was tempted to give five stars. But not as good as season one.

Can get a bit cloying at times, a few of the characters (Miss Lane, Thomas Brown) can get a bit tiring after they have shown their character quirks many times. But still greatly appreciated to have a series with positive stories and lacking the typical violence and sex of other TV fare. And perhaps taken in smaller doses than I do, it might be less cloying.

A few of the episodes "go off the deep end" with supposed ghosts and voices being heard. Seemed hardly needed, and not compatible with the realistic tone of the other episodes.

Some of the episodes and characters are very touching. For example, the little boy Sidney is a touching character. I'm interested to see what will happen to him.
I really enjoy watching shows based on this era and I love british shows most of all.  They tend to be cleaner but still cover issues we face today.
The villagers are very entertaining.  This is a great series that requires no thinking, just enjoyment.  If you like any historical novels, you will like this series.
I love this series its a great escape from the modern world to a place where the idea community means something.
I Love it.  I totally enjoy watching movies, tv etc from this time period.  Downton Abbey is another favorite. Keep them coming

This series is one of the best I have ever watched. The characters were cast perfectly. All the acting is superb. The emotions they express in their voices, eyes and body language makes you forget they are acting because they have really become those people. The story lines are wonderful and build on each other. You care about each person and cheer them on when they suffer adversity or feel for them when they suffer heart break and despair. I don't want this series to ever end. The BBC has produced so many wonderful programs.
Great series, I am unhappy that I couldn't have rallied when it was airing to preserve such a well written show.  I think we should all wonder "what would Dorcas Do?"
Just down to earth, it is fun to see how people probably lived in that era. It is a decent show even your children can watch and not wonder if something bad is going to come on the screen.

Great series for anyone who enjoys BBC actors/productions!
Wonderful characters, great acting, beautiful scenery and music, well-written, enjoyable and also periodically invites reflection.  Was very sad to see the series end!

I really enjoy these types of shows, good clean entertainment.
I would recommend to anyone who that enjoys period movies.
This show has it all. Funny sad mystery. Everything good entertain end should be and then some. Not some shallow romantic tale but real to life.
Wholesome family drama, fun and interesting. Love all the character development and different subplots. It really sucked me in a and I wanted to find out what happened next in their lives.

I like the fact that this is a clean fun show and that the issues faced by the characters relate to things that happen in daily life for a lot of people.  The relationships between the characters is endearing.
Wife and I love watching it together. Really enjoy the acting and character development.  Stories is engaging and watching it is fun.
This series is set in early 1880's both in small village and large hamlet, the story is believable and endearing.
So nice to see something "clean" and enjoyable! Wish there was more like programs/series like this. Nice to be able to watch it with out having to worry about the kids being in the room.

Just love this era.  Wish there were 10 more seasons. Let me know if it continues as a series
.
This series has great acting and wholesome content as well as being comical at times. I would highly recommend it.
I loaded this on my kindle and watched parts of it on a flight overseas. Really a fun series to watch. I am sorry it was dropped mid-season #4

Lark Rise to Candleford is an absolutely amazing program, with 4 seasons to date. It is one of a kind about two towns, on a village really, and the other a town progressing with the times. But the people in this series are so interesting that it leaves you waiting on the next show to find what happens next. It is perfectly great for the whole family. I just loved it and have watched it over and over!
I didn't think that I would love the next season as much as the first, but I am happy to say that all the actors have delivered beyond my expectations. Just started Season 3 and love it.
as a grown American man I shouldn't like the show but I really do. Fantastic dialog, interesting characters, old school story telling.
This is quality entertainment for the whole family originally broadcast through PBS/BBC. Superb cast and interesting stories set in the English countryside are consistently entertaining!

I find this show to be far more artistic than most American produced television. The photography is beautiful and the writing is superb. I love the subtle execution of a worthy theme in each episode. The characters are well developed. Each episode ends before I am ready to be finished watching, but I am left feeling uplifted and a better person for watching. In other words, this is not cheap entertainment!
A true gem. I am watching the series for the second time, and it keeps getting better. I still miss Timothy.
I have enjoyed watching this series and following the characters throughout the stories.  I would highly recommend for others to watch.

I loved the first season.  Season two is even better.  The characters grew and evolved in so many wonderful ways.  I look forward to see what happens next.  I would recommend this series to anyone who likes a good story to laugh and cry over.
Heartwarming and sweet.  You will love all the characters and their quirks.  This series just makes you feel warm and happy inside!
Our whole family loves to watch this show. We found it while waiting for Downton Abbey to return! Totally worth your time!
Enjoyed the second season as much as the first!  The  young man who play Alf is such a good singer and has memorable eyes.  All good.
This is one heck of a show!  I must say, the acting is impressive.  Each person plays their roll well!  I can't tell you how much I've enjoyed this series.
The acting is superb. The sets, costumes, writing and the actors blend beautifully for a delightful viewing experience. I have recommended it to some friends.
Loved the costumes, story line and just getting into each character.  Wish they made tons more seasons.  Very entertaining for an evening of the Victorian era.

I equate "Lark Rise to Candleford" as something akin to "Little House on the Prairie" in its moral lessons and the interdependence of the locals.  I find it an enjoyable show when I am not interested in a heavy plot or mega-action/adventure, but still seek a storyline with some depth and thought.  These folks show the best of human nature....what we could aspire to be.
Love this series!  Great cast -- so much fun watching the interactions between them in each episode.  Fun family fare!
Very entertaining, Love and  independent women but even as people were poor they took time to enjoy family and seemed more relaxed about swrtain things.
This is an awesome period piece and family friendly too! I highly recommend it! You will be all caught up in the goings on of both Candleford and Larkrise before you know it!

I enjoyed this season very much...
All the characters were so authentic and it was easy to become involved in their daily affairs.

My whole family is into this show now and we watch it whenever possible. I absolutely love it. The writing is so good, the actors are so lovable, the plots are fascinating, the England scenery is sometimes breathtaking - a lot of the scenes look like they could be still photos. Love love love this show. I seriously cannot get enough of it.

I watched all four seasons in about three weeks or so and really enjoyed the settings and the characters. Highly recommended for Anglophiles and anyone missing their Downton Abby or Upstairs Downstairs.  Its a little more slowly paced and episodes are more self contained --not so many cliff hangers as in D.A.  But still very enjoyable.
Happened upon this while searching for BBC programming. Interesting plot with different story lines each episode. Great to catch as an Amazon Prime member.
I love this series.  I have watched season 1 and almost finished with season 2..  Looking forward to seasons 3 &4.  I will be sad to see it end.  I love all the characters.

This is a nice story with comfortable characters.
Some are rough around the edges and some are too up itty , but still enjoyable.
This second season was better than the first. I had to discipline myself to watch only two episodes per night and can't wait to start season 3.
Great acting by all. Very well written. The scenery is fantastic, opens up a new insight into th lives of the different classes.
Lark Rise to Candleford is such a good series.  I love the moral messages in each episode, they are very relatable to real life.  This is a great show you can watch with your whole family.
I am so in Love with this unique series and the layers in the characters. Iam sad to say it will end but I highly recommend this ;)
We enjoy watching positive stories of life whether present or past. Lark Rise to Candleford is well worth an evenings' time.

It makes one realize how uninvolved the government was in supporting people in their daily lives.  People had to work hard or do without.  I enjoy the use of the stone built homes and the vision of how life must have been like.  I enjoy the interaction between the characters, the politeness, and respect they gave one another.
This is a lovely English series full of lots of enjoyment.  Really good acting.  I can hardly wait for the next series.
We love the series (even my husband), but the second season has a few episodes I was disappointed with; one was a little creepy with a ghost, one seemed to be making a political statement.
My wife and I enjoy, and get caught up in, every episode. The characters are sympathetic, the plots interesting, and the whole 19th century atmosphere is charming. It's also often humorous.
This series is wonderful for anyone who might be a Ritish history buff or wo likes old British drama. Must watch!
I've always liked these homey English dramas and this one just fit the bill!! It's well cast with many faces known to the American Public.
I happened upon this and am so glad I did.  Have recommended it to friends and they all love it too!
My wife and I watch a couple episodes every night. Episode themes are always different and acting is great.  Another great English series.
More great programming from BBC.  Just finished watching Season 2 and look forward to learning more about the characters in Season 3.
This show is a charming and fun. The whole family can enjoy this series because it's morally good and clean enough for the youngest children in your family.
I love this series.  All of the characters are interesting and engaging.  The stories are simple but fascinating.  I looked forward to watching each episode.
This series offers a great option to all the syfy and action media exploding across the screen nationwide. Good personal drama.
Enjoyable and entertaining, hated to see it end.  Female drama but the men might like some of the historical aspects.  Good look into English history for we Americans.
A very nice mini series. You must watch it in sequence to appreciate this wonderful day to day life. enjoy!
I love how the characters grow and the story lines are great.  I especially like Dorcas and Minnie.  Thomas makes one laugh with his stiffness.  I hope he makes a good husband.  Stay tuned!
I love movies about life in a more simpler life.  Gentile and full of honor. No sex and cursing life that is gracious.
I wish there were more shows like this one!  There are so many lessons taught in such a thought provoking atmosphere.

I have now watched all four seasons of Lark Rise to Candleford and loved them all.  It's addictive.  If you like Downton Abbey you'll love this.  It is more of a working class Downton. in about the same time period.
As season One.  Lots of new characters added to story line yet continuing the stories of our favorites.  I look forward to watching it every night!
It is soooooo refreshing to be able to watch something wholesome in these days of exploitive and degrading television.  This series is "my one weakness"
Excellent!!! I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of Lark Rise. Adventure, romance, suspense, sorrow, it had it all. I highly recommend this series!

We've always enjoyed period pieces -- especially when the BBC is handling the story line and camera! More light-hearted than Downton Abbey or Upstairs/Downstairs, Lark Rise to Candleford presents a somewhat idyllic tight-knit community with lovable characters.
Top quality BBC programming. Takes you back to a time when things seemed so much more simple. Excellent series, so disappointed to hear that the BBC cancelled the show.
A heartwarming story of a simpler time in life. You fall in love with the characters. Many life lessons to be learned within the story.
It is hard to stop watching.  All characters have their own little quirks and stories are different weekly.  Really am enjoying it.
Enjoyed all the seasons.  Loved the characters (and actors who portrayed them)  Great story lines, beautiful scenery.  Wish there were more seasons!

Just as enjoyable as the first season. Despite the one or two weaknesses that Dorcas lays claim to she still remains the center of the community and the cast of characters continues to revolve around her.  Looking forward to season 3.

I watch one of these episodes every day at lunch, and I can't get enough! I love the characters and the stories, especially because many of them engage important questions about love, marriage, family, and gender roles in a really meaningful way. Unlike most shows, this one builds me up and helps me think instead of filling my head with junk.
Each season brings new growth in the characters and they grow in character through pain and love and a big family does, I cry and laugh at each episode.

I am so glad I found this British series on Amazon streaming.  It's basically about two English country towns at the end of the 1800s.  Lark Rise, the farmer/unskilled laborer hamlet and the nearby "town" of Candleford.  The Lark Risers are proud and hard working, but uneducated - the Candlefordians also work hard, but certainly have a lot more luxuries in life and either inherited their good fortune or had the benefit of more education.  The tale is narrated by Laura, a teenage girl who leaves Lark Rise to work at the Post Office in Candleford.  Each location has its own wonderful quirky cast of characters.  Occasionally, the two classes mix when necessary.  This series has everything you could ask for - humor, hardships, tragedies, triumphs, love, passion, mysteries, rivalries, etc.  It's very entertaining and it has Brendan Coyle (lately of Downton Abbey fame)!  I highly recommend it.
I loved this series.  I got caught up in the everyday lives of these charming people. This is a must see.
Characters are fun to watch as they go through their daily lives.  Each show has been well thought out and endears the characters to you.  Nice family show.

I cannot say enough about this series that the BBC has filmed. It is a period piece but the situations and issues that the characters deal with could be those we face today. The show portrays positive family values and characters that are believable that deal with real life situations.  It is positive television done well.
