This is a wonderful show with everything I look for.  It has humor, warmth, honesty, and a subtle beauty I haven't seen in years.  The cast is wonderful, the settin magical, and the look is just perfect. I can't recommend this show enough!! What a joy and a total surprise.

This is one of my favorite series.  Absolutely love the character development.  I'd say the character development is some of the most advanced and realistic I've ever seen.  Characters that you originally think ok turn into endearing lovable ones as the series progresses.  Characters who make a great first impression evolve into more complex individuals as their weaknesses are exposed.

I'm totally hooked on this show and have recommended it to my friends.  I Almost hate to
see the ending.
I'm addicted to this show. You never know what's going to happen, even though it's not a teary-eyed drama every week. It makes me yearn to live there.

I really enjoyed the social gathering of family, friend, and foes.  It's a time when the older ways were changing and a time when they are entering new beginnings.  The struggles of dealing with the past and present.  Very compelling story.
I really think these are great shows. Can't wait to watch season 3.  It would be a great family show as well.
Love this series. You instantly fall in love with each quirky character. Wish it was still being made. I still see it on PBS occasionally.

I came to this series late so got to watch all of the seasons in quick succession. It is a wonderful series that captured my heart immediately and I couldn't wait to find out what happened from one episode to the next. My only complaint was that it ended!

real human interactions, people treat each other with dignity and respect and try to work out their problems without total destruction of the other person's ego. There is much joy to be had in this series. People argue and misunderstand, they make mistakes and break hearts, but they all help to heal these breeches, too. This is how we need to be treating each other now

I can't say enough about this show. It touches on so many great themes that are still relevant to people today, simply because of our humanity. But I also enjoy the elements of small town life near the turn of the century, the struggles and triumphs. Love, loss, sacrifice, gender equality, social status, religion, science, the arts, community, poverty--all of it!
I highly recommend this!  Never a dull moment at the Post office!  I looked forward to every episode! Wish they never ended the series.

This show has a very subtle blend of spiritual values. Interesting in its rejection of common contemporary values. More of a traditional American approach to self reliance, work, and family. Seems an odd show for a highly socialist Britain. Think of the 'coin' to the kids, compare J.C. Penny. Interesting.
Love this series. Wonderful characters and great actors. I have watched this series time and time again. It never fails to amaze me. I have the book, also.
Wonderful show. I can't get enough of it. So glad there are 4 seasons of this show and they are on Prime. I'll be sad to finish the series.

It is family safe, no profanity, no nudity, no gunfire, just a wonderful, relaxing view. I have truly enjoyed this look back at the English countryside, two villages, and the interaction of two social classes. It is an escape to a pleasant, simpler time before radios, television or cell-phones. There are not even any automobiles! I strongly recommend this program!

My husband and I can't wait to put our kids to bed so we can curl up and enjoy the meaningful, witty, and good clean enjoyment of this series.  We enjoyed season 1 very much with all its charm, wit and beautiful scenery and season 2 is equally as engaging.  We were sad to see Sir Timothy go but this season has a few surprises of its own that make the departure worth it.
good humored, and fun to watch, really enjoyed all of it, and my husband did too!  would definitely watch again.

So love this series! Can't say enough about how wonderful I think it is and how much I enjoyed it. A clean family type show that entertains and inspires as well. Only fault is in the fact that the series came to an end. Great acting, costumes, history, comedy, love stories, and well rounded characters. 5 stars are not enough!
I SIMPLY LOVED THIS SERIES.  IT WAS ENGAGING AND QUITE INTERESTING.  I ONLY WISH IT COULD HAVE GONE ON.  HOPING THERE WILL BE MORE SERIES TO FOLLOW.
I just wish there were another season. We loved the story, the characters, the photography and all the details of production. The world needs more of this type of entertainment/education.
I watch one episode each time I walk on the treadmill.  The developing characters, storyline. and beautiful scenery keep me coming back for more. No fancy special effects here, just great acting.
Wonderful season and a spectacular show, but I didn't like the conclusion to the season. I felt that things should have gone differently.
I have to admit, I'm hooked to the quirky charm of it....definite must see. Brendan Coyle is wonderful and just one of many of the great talent on this series

I love this series because it's "clean" and unlike the TV shows today.  Also, it's great to see people holding each other accountable even when they don't like it.  Something we need to go back to and teach children as well as adults today.

A fan of Brendan Coyle since viewing North and South last(?) year. Wonderful to see other familiar BBC faces. Love the timeless feeling of the show, there's something that's somehow familiar in that way of life. I love the naturalness of song as entertainment and community sharing.

After watching Downton Abbey, all 3 seasons and loving it, I looked for something new and found Lark Rise to Candleford. It took longer for me to really get hooked but it did happen somewhere near the end of the 1st season. I loved season 2!
Loved this series. No four letter words.  Refreshing...really get tired of hearing a bunch of trash talk. Thanks for having this in your video library.
I only regret that it ended so soon. I enjoyed this series as much as anything I have ever watched.
Love this show.  so gentle and great acting in a beautiful place. This is the second time I have watched it.
good entertainment for family. Hard to find just plain good shows anymore that whole family can watch together. Highly recommend.

A completely enjoyable show. The filming is lovely, the characters appealing, and the story line focuses on relationships. There is no violence, yet it is realistic in its basic truths. This is the story of "the old ways."
Really nice to find something to watch.  It gives little points to ponder throughout the series.  Any age group can watch.  Nice change from American tv.
My wife's favorite show and I like it too. Very well written and the acting is also great along with the scenery.
LOVE IT.....LOVE IT....LOVE IT!  The best program on TV.  Need more episodes!  Never tired of the TV show! Love it!

A good family movie.

I chose this movie series because it looked as if it would be a good family movie.  I wasn't disappointed.
Haven't made it far, and it's already deterred from the first season a bit, so they're mixing it up, but I enjoy the show thoroughly.

This is an intimate look at life in the country. What make it so special are the many character actors who do their jobs so well. They face challenges our society has long forgotten. From the "Lord of the Manor," to the "Post-Mistress," and the poor of the village, we soon realize that they are all Special People. This was a wonderful series about a wonderful group of people!
It is hard to find things to watch these days that aren't full of language, sex and violence.  I wish there was more out there like Larkrise to Candleford.
I love the series hope there is more to come!!!!  There are not many shows that great to watch. GREAT!
This series has superb dialogue (expertly written) and excellent acting. The best part is no sex, violence, drugs. I would recommend this to anyone.
As I fell in love with the first season, so I fell in love with this season as well.  Such a great show!

If you are a fan of the British Drama (for which I have just recently become from watch Downton Abbey), you will love this show also. I wish more American TV could compare.  This show is family oriented with good values.  Here I want to personally thank Amazon (and those in the UK responsible for producing the show) for bringing this type of television viewing to us.
Lark Rise to Candleford is one of the most enjoyable shows I've seen on TV ever. Wishing for more of it.

I am transitioning from one state to another and don't have cable. I was looking for shows to watch on Roku and this had a high ranking.

I really enjoyed the series. I found myself getting somewhat addicted to Dorcus and her embraceable character. I gave in to her expression...."It's my only weakness..."

The series is somewhat corny but I don't mind that. It is enduring, manifesting human values such as kindness, nosiness, weakness, weariness, hardship and love. It is a series with substance and a great ensemble of actors/actresses. You get over any problems you have with individual characters and end up liking each for it's special contribution.

The post office setting is interesting to watch given everything is manual. The English countryside with struggling farm workers that can barely afford to rent their homes and its' neighboring somewhat wealthier community is different if you are from the U.S. but probably ends up being universal so everyone can relate in the end.

Everyone did a good job on this series from writers and producers to actors. Enjoyed it VERY much! Also, it ended well so I was relieved of this.
...and the saga continues in the lives of the people of Lark Rise to Candleford!  What a wonderful series that I enjoy watching in the evening.  A series that will bless anyone!
We like the story line and the acting is really good.  Character development is first class as you work through the season.
This is a safe family show with morals. I loved that every story had a message. I love the romance stories. Would definitely recommend!

Larkrise to Candleford was recommended to me by a friend and we love it! The relationships between the characters are real and redemptive. The father, played by Brendan Coyle, is a strong man who leads his family in love and hard work.  So refreshing to watch rather than the typical buffoon that most TV fathers are made out to be. You should watch the show from beginning to end. It's just really, really good.
The story is warm. It reflects human's nature in both side. But it always leads to a positive way. I love it and I felt bad that BBC did not continue Season 5.
Love this series. The characters are wonderful. Once I started watching I wanted to keep watching. The relationship between the characters seems so genuine.

While Season 2 is also quite enjoyable, I preferred Season 1. Season 2 is much more blunt in it's escapades and a bit more racy than probably would have actually been for the time period. Not that it's out of line for viewing, but a bit questionable in nature at times. Excellent series.

This is a great series!!!! Great development of characters and plots. Only problem was there were only 4 seasons (last one very short) and last episode not really wrapped up on some story lines and quickly completed with others. I will definitely watch again though.
I thoroughly enjoy this show. It is quality entertainment and far surpasses anything I have viewed in the past on tv.
This cast of characters is charming and lovable.  After one show, you will find yourself wanting to watch again and again.  A fine BBC production with excellent actors and actresses.  A must to view!
This is the most beautifully done series I have ever had the privilege of viewing.  This is MUST SEE TV!
It's a wonderful look into history while presenting some wonderful characters. I'm so disappointed that the series ends after four seasons!
Love the correct usage of language, the costumes are beautiful, peaceful times, wish everything was more simple now. O well it's the price we pay for technology.

A wonderful second season of Lark Rise.  This is such a great feel good series, I felt my self wanting to be there!  This reminds me a lot of the Walton's or Little House on the Prairie and the cast does such a phenomenal job.  Even my boyfriend whom you would never see watching British "soap opera" type series, was in love with the show and the cast. Well done!

Started watching because I like Brendan Coyle in Downton Abby, but kept watching because I grew to like the characters and the writing. Then I realized Julie Sawalha was playing the part of Dorcas Lane . . . that kept me watching

I love all the characters and how the show brings out the individual problems and hardships that each one faces in that time period.
It makes me appreciate how easy our lives are today compared to how little most had back in their day.  Communities came together to help each other and neighbors helped each other; something that is lost in our society today.
We watch an episode every night!  We love this show!  Our family loves to eat popcorn and watch this together.  Thanks for putting this on Amazon prime!
It's hard to find a good series these days but this is one of the best. It was well worth watching. Superb acting!
I enjoyed every minute of this series I believe even more than Downton Abby.  The actors were wonderful and the story refreshing.

This series has everything! Romance, humor, pathos, mystery, etc.. I don't know if they film this in location, but the scenery is amazing. It makes me want to visit there. The whole cast is wonderful (especially Brendan Coyle). I first became a fan when I saw him in Downton Abbey as Bates. There are so many characters I love in this series. Twister, Ruby, Minny, Emma, and Thomas just to name a few. I just hope they keep going on and on and on.
Very well written and played.  Good, clean, wholesome entertainment.  I'll be sad to see the series end.  That's all folks!

Interesting character sketches of human relationships.  Nice to be able to sit down and watch something without a constant compromise of values in the watching.  I look for clean and wholesome and positive wisdom for life's struggles.
This wonderful story continues to enthrall me. I feel like I know these people. My favorite is Minnie! Her character is developing into such a wonderful lady.

This show is delightful. The characters are interesting and the plots developed.  It's refreshing to see difficult, real- life situations faced with courage and grace and ingenuity instead of the usual TV fare of murder and revenge and backbiting. Here, strength of character is something a person is encouraged to emulate. They not only benefit but the community as well. Thank you for such a refreshing show.

As fans of Downton Abbey, we were looking for another English dramedy set a century or so ago. The actress portraying the main character, Lara, is not great but everyone else is outstanding, particularly Dorcas and the character that becomes everyone's favorite is Thomas the postal carrier.

I love this series.  The characters and stories are a fine example of people living meaningful lives based on strong values and care for family, friends and community.  Watching these programs leaves me feeling peaceful and contented.  I choose to be happy and to support my choice I no longer feed my attention into those programs which cause tension or stress.  This series supports my choice to be happy :)
gets better with each episode! looking forward to season 3 and 4! so sad that there are only 4 seasons :(
The show is interesting and heart warming. I loved the multiple story line and the twists and turns. You can't help fall in love with Candleford.
I love this series! It is very well produced with beautiful scenery, well written  and endearing characters,  and thought provoking story lines.

Great continuation of the lives of everyone in Candleford and Lark Rise. Must see if you've watched Season One. Ms. Lane and Laura both have their hearts broken. But as expected with these two strong women, they survive and manage to move on.
The 2nd season continues to bring excellent story lines.  I'm just sorry there are only 4 seasons.  TV would be much better if there were more shows like this one.
I have really enjoyed this show. Good story, good actors, clean and no violence. I am so glad I found it. Love it!
I am now onto Season 3 and I can't stop watching!  I usually watch more than one episode at a time.  I will be sorry when I finish all 4 Seasons!
I enjoy this series!  It shows a much different way of life.  The characters are well played and I can't wait to see the next season to find out more what happens!

This series shows, once again, that the Brits know how to do engaging drama.  The characters are fully developed and the stories reveal a charm and pathos, with just the right amount of humor, that keep the viewer wishing for more.  Lark Rise to Candleford is story telling at its best!
A truly heartwarming series!!!!!!! The characters are fascinating and the scenery breathtaking I highly recommend it!! Can not imagine why it only had 4 seasons.
I was surprised to see the supernatural come into the first episode. It did seem rather out of character, but I liked it.
The storylines get a little cheesy from time to time, but this show is always good, solid entertainment... especially if you love British period pieces. It's my version of "mindless TV" time.
Beautiful sets, great character development, and wonderful stories each episode make this series a winner in every respect.  I highly recommend.
I looked forward to each episode. I was sad that the series ended.  Hoping that they will bring it back.
Wonderful characters.  Grown to love each one.  The human interactions are timeless.  Great lessons on doing what is right and just, no matter what your circumstances.
Highly recommend this series.  The storylines are neat, clean and fun to follow and the characters are endearing.  A nice entertaining escape from the modern day.

I love this show as its clean, entertaining and everyone is dressed modestly. It has an Anne of Green Gables/Road to Avonlea feel to it. I've found in a lot of tv series they end up kinda repeating story line....with enough of a twist it's different....but it's not to me. :) I haven't seen that in this show. I was so excited to find a clean show to watch!!

I enjoyed Lark Rise to Candleford because it is clean in speech and the old way of using the english language,was charming to me. It is very easy to get attached to the characters,the plot is easy to follow and has a good story line.
the stories are captivating...you smile,laugh and feel the pain of the people as they strive to make life in the days when to live was a struggle just for a meal...powerful show!
Outstanding acting and good stories. My wife and I are hooked on this series. We look forward to each new episode.

This series is such a delight.  The writing, the acting, the actors, the photography, the story line - the development of the characters and the several unique ones -  make this story superior in so many ways.  This is also a series that is family friendly without being a children's series.  How unusual is that!

This series is so wonderful.  I wish there were more shows like this on American Television...it reminds me of the British version of "The Waltons".  The same family dynamic and same life lessons....with a little more humor.  This is quality TV....love it and wish there were more seasons.
Good, clean, family-friendly show.  I would definitely recommend this for anyone not wanting to be subjected to the trash TV of our present day.
I'm constantly amazed at the ability of all the actors/actresses to make their characters so believable. I will be so sad to see this series come to an end.

We were hooked on this from the get go. There characters are funny and charming. The post man is
a little aggravating at times but that is how his character was written.
I really have enjoyed this series and the actors! In a period setting, the program exudes family values and community with a sense of consequences.

I have watched all seasons on TV and came back to watch again. These two towns are full of characters u will want to follow as they go about their many adventures. The cast is superb.
The story centers around the post office in Candleford and it's post mistress and her staff. It extends to the small town of Lark Rise and their families who are less affluent.
Each episode is a tale of their triumphs and woes.
Watch and enjoy!

In times like these, I look to watching shows that take us back to simpler and less compicated times. With good story lines and wonderful characters, I just totally enjoy the entire series of "LARK RISE TO CANDLEFORD".
Each character is so unique and true to themselves in every episode.  A lesson in every episode.  The singing and music are wonderful.  A simple time, with struggle. Love the community spirit.

It as about the industrial, pre-train era during the mid 1800 in rural England.  The stories are about life in a remote and nearby hamlet and the social divide amongst an entire population of poor town folks and even poorer farm hands - all so far from 'society' or 'wealth' of any sort, it seems silly to us these days.

But the simple charm of the stories focusing on risky and scandalous behavior .... for the times, is sweet and charming.  The times when anything above the hands not covered was shocking.

Fun to sit and watch the whole series on a lazy weekend.
This is a wonderful series. Wonderfully written and acted.  You really find yourself in Lark Rise and Candleford along with all the characters. They become so alive to you.

I chose this rating because I found this series so interesting. The characters were quirky but pulled together to help each other when needed. They weren't perfect but they dealt with their problems. It is not a high society English drama. These are working people. There are two communities. One is rural with people that work the land. The other community was a small town. This show is character driven with their interaction making the bulk of the show. I recommended this to my sister and she really liked it also.
This one was new to me. Beautifully written, acted and produced. Wonderful stories. Love to see British actors from other classic minseries show up here, especially Lydia from Pride and Prejudice.
The show is very gentle and often preachy yet I love to watch it.  It is spot on to the time period in dress, demeanor, cadence, atmosphere and attitude.
The cast as well as the storyline continues to draw you in. Interesting twists in the characters lives in this season throws you on a rollercoaster of awe. This show never ceases to amaze!

I watch 1 episode every night, I just love it!!!!
would highly recomend it for late teen girls and women of all ages!!
Great viewing entertainment. Wholesome, well written and actors are exceptional. It is hard to find good quality entertainment, this is a gem.

I'm not a big fan of TV in general, but I do love PBS. Larkrise is such a great show; pitting the warm, simple farming community of Larkrise against the growing "metropolis" of Candleford. I've watched Season 1 and Season 2 and am now enjoying Season 3. The show has its share of "controversy" and intrigue, but never compromises the overall morality portrayed in the show unlike a lot of TV nowadays. It has many redeeming qualities and the main characters are very well-developed. I love this show and it's truly become my favorite.
finished series four. hope five will be available soon. loved it. I do hope this great story will continue on.
This is (was) a delightful series. I only wish I had known about it before.  Great cast and acting.  Sorry it didn't continue.
What life should be!  Some people would call it corny but so be it.  Enjoyed last season and am liking this also.

This is the place I go to visit when I am needing comfort--always a good story, people that have become as close as family, all wearing wonderful clothes, and living lives that I find fascinating!  You can't go wrong here.
The characters are unusual each in their own way and make you care what happens to them. Good period drama.
I am so pleased to have found this series. The characters are so well done. I like it better than Downton Abbey.

Love this program!  The life lessons are taut in a very down to earth way, and the characters and way of life back then are depicted beautifully.  Scenery is also most beautiful!  I wanted to be there with them .  Perhaps the old ways were the best ways!

Though on the surface this might seem like nothing more that a narrative of characters in a town and a hamlet and how they interact, it is far more.  It often takes the characters down roads which highlight important social and personal issues.  In addition, we are watching the development of 3 dimensional characters whose mistakes often reveal the humanity of even those who are good people.
This is a delightful series with endearing characters.  Fans of Anne of Green Gables and Downton Abbey will enjy this Edie's.
See my review on season one. Still keeping my interest in this season. Characters are evolving along with new ones being introduced into the show.

Yes, I realize all of us live in the 21st Century; however, watching "Lark Rise" it is easy to believe one is in the mid-19th Century, just before the Industrial Revolution.

The series is well cast and believable acted (except when they go 'over the top' with a couple of characters). What else can I say? I am an escapist when it comes to entertainment. "Lark Rise" takes me away. I've watched four seasons and would view more.
I had to finish this series once I started, so I was up late for over a week seeing all four seasons!  Left me wanting more!!!

I watch it on TV and if I miss an episode, I can see it on my Kindle.  I love the series and I hope it continues for many seasons.  I enjoy all of the English programs, Cranford, Downton Abby, Midwife, Mr. Shelfridge etc.  They are all great and the actors and actresses are fabulous.  They are very entertaining programs.

I love this series and wish it would never end.  I have read that the producers decided to stop while it was going well.  I think it would have continued to go well.  We were all disappointed.  The show was so rich and touching.  I loved it.
I think the same of all the episodes in the Lark Rise to Candleford series.  Thank you for offering it .
Quality family entertainment. Historical, witty, and charming. Each program is more delightful than the last. A must see,for family members of all ages.

In Lark Rise and Candleford you meet the people unknown in the world of Downton Abbey.  I wouldn't call it a superior world, but it is a world in which problems are solved by kindness and consideration by people living the most ordinary of lives.
great wholesome stories and a lesson is always learned, wish season 4 was out or should i say i hope there will be many more seasons
This series seasons 1,2,3,&4 are very worth the time and the money spent on a Prime membership. I'm watching it for the second time.
I love this series and look forward to watching more episodes. thank you for putting a great BBC program on Amazon Prime.
Very good story.  Language good, not vulgar. Keep you in suspense! Continue to offer more programming of this type. please.

Each new episode was like reading a novel. I didn't want to stop watching until I got the end of the seasons episodes.
I was sorry when it ended. Wanted to see how the families survived the industrial revolution.
Recommended viewing.
I love this show, and the PBS broadcasts are very poor quality, this way I can watch them all at ,y leasure and the quality of the video is amazing
Full or drama and comedy this period piece has become one of my favorites and unlike many it has a full 4 seasons!
I love this show.  The characters.  The situations and relationships they find themselves in.  Well done and entertaining.  I only have 2 more episodes in the final season.  Then what will I watch?

Don't get me wrong, I love Downton Abbey, but I just can't stop watching Lark Rise To Candleford.  I love all of the characters, both good and not so good.  This show is  entertaining in every way and I always laugh, cry and want more with every episode.  I never want it to end!
Great characters, lovely scenery and good story lines make for enjoyable watching, episode after episode. I would highly recommend this one.
Good show that can be enjoyed by the entire family. No foul language. Presentation shows quality in all phases of the production!

The reason I appreciate the show is because family members of all ages can watch it. It is a little bit like the Waltons, in that there is always a moral to the story. The acting is very good, as well.
This production captures all the quiet beauty of the English countryside and presents a list of well developed characters who are captivating and enthralling

Season Two continues to show us more of the beloved characters and weave the viewer deeper into the relationships in Lark Rise and Candleford. I definitely developed my affinity for my favorite characters in Season Two. This show is such a great way to relax and get caught up in tales where the best of humanity always prevails. It's just sweet and warm.
This is an awesome story from the story line to the superb job of the actors, etc. It has been a wonderful experience for me!
This show is fantastic. It's entertaining and I want to watch episode after episode. It's very clean, and also teaches great moral lessons.
Again, as with Season 1, I loved the stories and the actors are simply wonderful! It's a good depiction of small town hierarchy at any place in time

I stumbled across the Lark Rise to Candleford series when browsing my Amazon Prime free videos list. I fell in love with the series from the very first show. I quite often chose to forgo whatever was showing on my TV cable channels to watch this. I only regret that the show was discontinued in the 4th season. But don't let that stop you! WATCH IT - you will love it. Thanks Amazon Prime - you are my one weakness!
Heart warming look at a simpler life. Family friendly but dealing with real life issues. Awesome. So sad it ended so abruptly in the fourth season

I stumbled upon this series and have been loving every minute of it.....
I truly enjoy tv shows like this one and hope to find more l

I found this to be along the lines of the BBC Pride and Prejudice or Wives and Daughters.  I appreciate the high quality of acting and the pleasant twists that might be predictable but are enjoyable just the same!  A far better alternative to cable :)

We find this similar to Downton Abbey but dealing with the tenants on a manor and locate small community life in that era.  Since it goes for 4 or 5 seasons you can watch the main characters grow and the changing history as well.

We will be sad when it finally ends, but will watch it again and again.

This was one of the most engaging series I have followed in a long time involving day-to-day experiences. Set in 1895 rural England, the cast of characters is great and can actually act and emote, contrary to most American actors. I am so disappointed it only had 4 seasons.

I just love this series.  Well done, interesting and the characters are portrayed in an excellent fashion.  I go home every night after my job ends (I work nights) and before I go to sleep I put this on in my Kindle Fire and I watch one episode a night.  I love it.  Im up to Season 3 episode 1.  I hope there are more like this out there.  Set in the late 1800's this is a must see.

I love this series. I love the setting (End of the 19th century), and I love the characters. It's so nice to be able to watch something together as a whole family without embarrassment. The characters are so vivid and interesting. The story lines are intriguing and fluid. My only sadness is that they stopped filming after the fourth season. That is totally sad.
Amongst the many characters that make up Lark Rise and Candleford, you can always look forward to a new adventure in one of their lives.  Always entertaining; always refreshing to watch.
Love it, love it, love it!  I loved Downtown Abby, Doc Martin series and now this one.  I was so happy I chanced onto this.
Wow.  I love this series.  It leaves the viewer wanting to see more.  I like the time period it is set in and the wonderful acting.
Wife & I enjoy this series.  Has some good characters and storylines.  Scenery is great in the show as well.

Most characters are believable and take one back to a purer time and place!
Would highly recommend to friends and family.
We need more tv like this!  And this series should be restarted!  The scenery, the good characters, the life situations are captivating!
Every season just gets better!  I love this series.  It is wonderfully done. I will miss this series when I watch the last episode.
I just love the characters in this series and the funny interactions between the towns.  My husband and I love to watch this together.

After Season 3 of Downtown Abbey concluded, I was telling a friend that I needed something to fill that void! She had just finished watching Lark Rise to Candleford, and highly recommended I give it a try. I AM HOOKED!! What a delightful story, 3 dimensional characters, and a cast that makes you want more and more!!  As I was explaining it to my husband, I said it's like Little House on the Prairie meets Downtown Abbey!!  It has heart, it's authentic and after each episode...you think about it for days!! Cannot say enough about this series....it is AMAZING!!

A friend mentioned "Lark Rise to Candleford" to me and I was surprised that I had not heard of it before.  I guess it was never shown on PBS.  If you love Masterpiece Theater and the classic BBC dramas like "Upstairs Downstairs" or "Downton Abbey", then you are sure to like this show as well.  I am completely sucked into the show and the characters.

What a delightful series.  I was sorry it ended.  The characters in the story were so real, and endearing, the costumes were splendid, if drab (which is so true to the times).  Even the rascals were lovable.

this series was a well told story. the story line captured my interest, the characters dealt with challenges in a very interesting manner. I couldn't wait to see what would happen next. Well acted the characters were well developed, loved the older couple of Queenie & Twister.

I enjoyed Lark Rise to Candleford Season 2 so much, I wanted to watch it slowly so it would not end.  The setting is in my dreams and the stories are not only precious but so decent...worthy of watching. Thomas Brown and his "endeavors," Dorcas and her one weakness(es), "Our Laura" and her young life maturing, experiencing, the Sisters who are not twins, Queenie.. on and on, these people are my friends, and I do not want to miss what happens next between the village and the town.

I Love this series! I would love to see more like this on Amazon Prime free streaming. Keep adding oldies but goodies! I am not into profanity, nudity or sexual immorality. Thank you for having this series as Netflix and Hulu Plus do not have it.

The first episode was downright creepy.

This season seemed to be all about setting up for the NEXT season.  Characters come and go.
Less time is spent in Larkrise, which was really a shame.

I'm moving on to season 3, hoping it is more like season 1.

My wife and I discovered this to be a welcome stop-gap until Season Four of Downton Abbey returns.  It is set in roughly the same time period, perhaps earlier, and the character development and storylines are similarly excellent.

The characters are so well written! The perfect person for each character. And happy endings are always great!
Missed Brendan Coyle when he was gone but it still was very good!

This wins the contest for quiant!!  Set  in a very quaint Engish village and hamlet, the competition and cooperation between Lark Rise and Candleford, as well as the on-going romantic interests, and Twister's antics (and occasional wise
advice) make this one of the best series ever!  As you watch you become involved in the village life.  My biggest concern is we have almost finished the series, and I will miss my "one weakness" ;-))
Since I loved the first season, it only made sense to buy the second!  I wasn't disappointed and already bought the third.

LOVE this series. Same "autobiographical" resonance as Jane Austen or L. M. Montgomery without the modern intrusions inevitable from a contemporary adaptation of a past era. Huge fan of Downton Abbey, but Lark Rise to Candleford feels more authentic.  Addresses timeless themes such as love, gender roles, poverty, fidelity, addiction, disappointment and loyalty with tasteful thoughtfulness.  And, unless you're an aristocrat, the pressures faced by these ordinary characters seem more "real" than most in Downton or Pemberley.
I love period movies and this TV show is one of the best.  I am completely involved in the characters lives and live it with them when I watch this show.

I found this show on our amazon prime list. It is such a good show! I wish they would have played it in the US! The story lines are always wholesome and honest. The people are believable and the music, costumes and settings are lovely. I love this show! I wish they wouldn't have canceled it! I have watched all four seasons twice! I am a very happy customer!

My family is really enjoying  the Lark Rise to Candleford series! It is very family friendly and enjoyable, which is hard to find these days. Interesting characters that provide thoughtful reflection of the story lines. You don't want them to ever end.
Great that they are in shorter segments also when you don't have time to watch a feature film. Good stuff!
My husband (who balked when I first introduced them) looks forward to them more than the kids (5 year old to teens).
we wish that they had more programs like this each chapter has a lesson to learn great for children ans adults
I started to watch this after watching Downtown Abbey.  I like this just as much,  There is a lot of humor.  Some of the best acting I can remember seeing.
The story live has taken a needed twist with the addition of a new gentleman's arrival in Candleford. Will he and Dorcas get together at some point?

This series is engaging and well acted.  The characters are well defined and believable.  Gives some incite into a small hamlet living in that era although in reality conditions must have been far worse.
Much like season 1, this is a very well done TV series. If you like Masterpiece Theater's, you will like this show.
I started this series and didn't really know what to expect. But I am so glad  I did....Sorry it only has 4 series!!!! I wish it would go on it was the best!!!!
Visiting other times is a very pleasant venture.  Especially British films.  The attention to detail of items, clothes of the era is especially interesting.
One of the most relaxing period programs I've ever seen.  If ever you need to get away from a stressful, hectic day, this should do it for you.

Finally....something that really has no violence, nudity, cursing, killing......etc.  What it does have is a great plot....great characters....laughter...comedy and fun!  I'm close to starting Season 4 now....and am sad that there aren't anymore after Season4....that I know of.

I love almost all of the characters!  especially ruby as she is hilarious in her role as the timid, copy-cat sister who has the more obvious soft spots in her character than her elder sister, pearl, who hides behide her own strong, albeit, very insecure and extremely critical facade. I enjoy the clear headed (most of the time) Emma, and her challenging and delightful husband Robert. Of course, the postmistress, Dorcas, keeps everyone level headed; rarely severe, she is tender, intuitive, and sensitive, showing kindness and forbearance with everyone, especially the very funny, simple, yet compilcated and quite frustrating maid.  Laura, is a lovely romantic, with intelligence and humour, giving a nice balance to the characters.  I do not really care for the full of himself- James Dowland, but that fact does not hinder my enjoyment of almost every episode; and the son that is produced at the end of the season is a wonderful addition to the series.

This show is top notch. Great sets, acting, storylines, music. I stumbled onto it through a recommendation from Amazon based on liking North & South. I can't believe that I hadn't heard about it before.

I was looking for something to fill the void when this year's Downton Abbey season finished.  I absolutely love this series and cannot figure out why in the world they stopped it after only 4 seasons, and the last season was only 6 episodes.  Each main character is well developed and the acting is superb.  They are all wonderful actors.  It's a shame the U.S. can't make a series like this which is family viewing yet with such good acting and story lines that adults can't wait for the next one.

The first 2 episodes were slow moving, but by the 3rd episode I was hooked.
Excellent stories and characters. The series ended well.

What a welcome relief from regular television programming!  Both my husband and I quickly became engrossed in the joys and challenges of the citizens of Lark Rise and Candleford. Somewhat like a British version of Little House on the Prairie.
I loved this season just the same as I loved the last season! It is a show that can be watched again and again.
Can't say anything bad about season 2, I am really enjoyed watching it, Great characters!! Can't wait to watch season 3.
I am only sorry there are not more episodes. I try to limit myself to one a day so I won't get through it too soon.

My husband and I love this series (and all Larkrise to Candleford series). I am not sure why we are so enamoured with these little rustic tales. Perhaps, it is because the stories are touching and poetic. The casting and acting is superb creating memorable characters.
And of course, Dorcas Lane is my one weakness.

I became hooked on this show after watching the first season, and it continues to maintain my undivided attention. I have become so very attached to these characters and places. The second season brings in new characters for some added romance and excitement. Keep watching! You won't regret it.
I enjoy turn of the century shows. The characters are fascinating; costumes beautiful; good acting; enjoy the show a lot!

Once again, you will continue to be deeply involved in all the wonderful 1800's English characters' escapades started in Season 1.
Will shy Thomas ever marry his sweetheart? Will young Laura keep her job in the larger town and find her first romance?
Again, all the town's folk are so realistic and delightful to watch!  You'll love Season 2.
I cannot find anything to criticize in this well rounded plot and the acting skills of this Lark Rise to Candleford II.!!!

I enjoyed this so much that I watched the whole four seasons in less than two weeks.

 I have even watched some of the episodes over again with a friend that I recommended it to.

The series provides an interesting look at the intersection of a small, subsistence farming hamlet and its neighbor, a village being slowly transformed by mechanization and links to the outer world. People work hard and must solve real survival and emotional problems, but there is no blood and gore. The pace is slow--like the daily life of the characters--but letting them grow as individuals is worth the effort. There is a strong emphasis on responsibility for one another and how we develop a personal sense of values to live by. but it's not prteachy. It's an engaging soap opera dressed up in BBC's finest staging, and an escape from today's terror and angst. You'll see lots of faces from other BBC productions, including Downton Abbey.

My wife and I enjoyed Lark Rise to Candleford so much we didn't want it to end.  This is a well produced and directed series with actors and actresses that grow on you.  You start to understand their personalities and always look forward to the next episode.  The series was refreshing in that it was very clean and wholesome to watch, void of smut and unnecessary sexual scenes.  Very enjoyable and like I said in the title, a series that you don't want to end!  Enjoy.
This drama is directly from the heart and the characters feel like your neighbors. You quickly care for the day to day stories  of each character. You don't want the stories to end.

So far I can't find anything I don't like about this series. Such a nice balance between humor and romance and intrigue. Reminds me of a family favorite "Little House on the Prairie" but with more depth and intelligence.
The wife and I love watching an episode an evening to escape from the dreary long winter's eves to a warm hearted tales of this fabulously acted out light-hearted drama.
Wonderful BBC series! Set in 1800's this period piece is very entertaining. Fans of period drama like Downton Abbey will enjoy this as well.
I love Lark Rise to Candleford! It is great to watch programs where there is no unnecessary sex and cussing. I am just sorry it had to end. I will watch it often.
I love the characters, rich and real.  Perfectly cast.  The emotions and lessons are wonderful.  I've watched it twice and will watch again.
This is just a Wonderful series - I would recommend this to anyone!  Love the BBC, keep them coming please!
Season one got us hooked.  Enjoying season two, unfortunate that we know there are limited seasons left.  Have recommended this.

I really like this show because it is like a mini Jane Austin movie every time I watch it.  It also has a good message in each episode that keeps me interested.  There's funny situations, sad and romantic ones as well. I also love learning how people lived 100 years ago and how they delt with everyday issues and problems.
I'm really enjoying Brendan Coyle as Robert Timmons, but the whole cast is excellent.  The various characters are fun to watch.
Still love looking at the countryside. Always interested in seeing how people are dressed and can't wait to get to the next episode. It's as addictive as Downton Abbey.
Such a wonderful interwoven series of stories!  Great for families; my teenage daughter and I enjoy watching the series together.
We love this program. Please recommend more shows similar to this tv series. I would love to receive a discount for being a loyal customer.
Just about the best series I have ever watched.  I will be very sad when I have watched every episode.
I was told if I loved Downton Abbey I would love this show too, so I went back and watched it.  It was true, I loved it!!!!  Wish there were more than 3 seasons!

One of the most delightful programs I have seen in a long time. I can hardly wait to see the next in the series. The characters are so real and so likable and the plots are interesting and believable.
I watched all 4 seasons and wanted more! The acting was great and the scenery beautiful.  I am going to watch it all over again.

Everything about this series makes me feel good.  The beautiful serene bucolic setting and all the lovely characters.
The slow moving life of a time gone by is a helpful and soothing experience whenever you take time to watch.

This show has so much drama in time when life was so simple. Day to day living was hard and laborious. The people were governed by morality and personal principles. Many times they were kick to judge by these strict moralities & principles before they had all of the facts. Lots of hearsay always came into play.
This is the prequel to today's soap operas

Once again like the 1st Season very good! Characters well written you get sucked into their everyday and sometimes night ordeal. Wish some characters had more parts in some episodes than some others but then of course we all have our "favorites".

There are no words to describe how much I LOVE this series!  I find myself rationing the rate at which I view each episode because I DON'T WANT IT TO END!!!  I actually feel smarter after having watched each one...thank you, Dorcas!
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS SERIES!!!

You walk away feeling like you can be a better person with this show.
You cant say that about many T.V shows or movies now a days.
Watch it while I jog.

I stumbled upon this series and fell in love. I've been told it doesn't hold a candle (no pun intended) to Downton Abby, so I can only imagine that I will become completely submerged in THAT show when I'm done with LRtC. This show is so engaging that I find myself thinking of the characters as I go about my normal day, as if they were people in my life. I am a busy mom and very social, so it is not as if I need fictional characters to fill my head, but they do, nevertheless. If you like the era and quirky characters, you'll like this show.
Season 2 is even more wonderful than season 1! The writing is great again, and there are are lots of twists and turns.
So sorry they did not continue the series! I loved it! I so wanted to see what would happen next.
Why is british television so much better than ours? This show is beautiful and the people are beautiful. I watch one a day and can't wait for the next one.
Very enjoyable, a step back in time to English country life.  A nice change from the forced TV of today.
it is. Great show if you like old time England.  Good stories and nice to find a program without sex and/or violence.  I wish there were more shows like this one.

I love to watch any period style series but this one in particular. The main character is a strong female often able to admit her mistakes or at least learns from them. The series does a good job introducing new characters often enough to keep the story fresh.
This series is so real and beautiful.  Family dynamics and friendships studied and solved by a few townspeople. Excellent series.  Looking for more of the same!
I am a big fan of period television and this is exactly why not to mention the strong female lead is just great

Highly recommend, I have watched all but the last season, which I am watching now. Aside from the accasional dropping the quality is very good. The picture is a little blurred at times but for the most part it is very good. Would like to know if the 4th season the last season?

My husband and I love this series.....it is wonderful! A very family show to watch together.
So many life lessons.
I loved it. Wish there were more to watch. I think anyone who likes masterpiece theater movies or series would love it also.
wonderful show. So glad Amazon has it all available. Great for Downton withdraw. This has really made it worth it to have a prime account.
Delightful series. Love to watch it on gray, rainy winter days while knitting, sipping wine, and enjoying the comfort of a crackling fire

This was a very good overall show to watch. It did seem to have political agendas at times as well as it seemed to make those that believed in God a little strange. Acting was good and plot followed through. One character left the show without explanation, not a major either but makes you wonder what happened.
I thoroughly enjoyed season one, and so looked forward to season 2.  this was not a disappointment.  i don't understand why it never made it to american tv.

Very entertaining.  Each episode has me anixious for the next. I love watching a whole series
and not having to wait for a week to see what happens.
Cant go wrong watching a show like this! The actors are talented and the costumes are so enchanting! Good clean entertainment full of humor, mystery, romance and drama.

Quirky characters, warm hearted stories, authentic scenery make Lark Rise to Candleford one of the best television series I have seen.  The warmth of The Andy Griffith Show, the charm of Downton Abbey, the humor and action portrayed by the cast is wonderful.  I like the character Brendan Coyle plays, championing the working man.  I hope this will one day be shown in the US.
I'm thoroughly enjoying season 2 of Lark Rise to Candleford. The acting is very good and the scenery is amazing.  It's nice to watch wholesome but not boring tv!

I give all the stars in the sky to "Lark Rise to Candleford" for its stories so full of good lessons and good cheer, for all the delightful characters supported by superb acting, for the beautiful scenery and for the marvelous background music.  The fabulous fashions of the Pratt sisters are a delight to see. I've just finished Season 1 and 2 and will continue with Season 3 and 4 - all on my Kindle Fire with its sharp clear pictures and great sound system.  I'm recommending this series to everyone.

Barbara, New York City
A nice, pleasant series.  Not overly dramatic, good lessons to learn and/or remember and happy endings.  Completely different than the violent or hate-filled shows that dominate TV nowadays.
I loved the series!  A movies for all ages.  Loved every minute of it.  Thank heaven there are good programs to watch.
I liked the series but I don't like your service ---you do not carry entire series, obviously, so one is unable to see the entire series--really dumb!
This series gets better when you think nothing can improve.  It is so enjoyable!!!  I look forward to each episode.

This is a good family type series, free of the violence so see on American made sitcoms.  It's a pleasure to watch a show with family values and high morals!  American TV has gone down the tubes - I detest those "reality" shows...soo stupid.
Possibly one of the best shows ever produced. I wish Hollywood could release shows like this instead of the trash currently being produced.
Wholesome entertainment and great fun to watch Downton's Mr. Bates in a role as a father. Good "Saturday Afternoon" entertainment and love the era!
This is my second time watching it and I love it. I am very attached to the many characters.  I even have my husband enjoying them with me this time.

Well-developed characters and story that are engrossing, more than just entertainment --  Beautiful production as with all Masterpiece Theatre features. If you like Downton Abbey or other period presentations, you should try this.
I loved it! Good clean entertainment! Well developed characters.and storyline. I highly recommend it to those who like Downton Abby.
I loved both seasons 1 and 2 of Lark Rise to Candleford.  Very sweet and warm stories.  Glad I got to see them since I didn't have the channel they originally aired on.
Season 2 continues the fun of watching the various character of Lark Rise and Candleford.  The excentricities continue from the characters introduced in Season 1.
Good show. I wish it hadn't been cancelled. The characters were easy to like. A good time period drama. Highly recommended.
great show and acting and costumes and olden times values--some crazy people but all delightful and do a great job

Highly recommend! We loved the whole series! Very family friendly and fun to see a little history along with many moral and relationship questions that arise within the everyday occurrences with these wonderful characters
We are truly enjoying the series. Don't want it to ever end !!he plots are great,. The writing is top rate!!
The acting is great. Good story-telling and themes throughout. I'm impressed with how they strive to keep with the historical accuracy too.
And I am on season three now.  Too bad there are only 4 seasons available.  I would recommend it to everyone who wants innocent entertainment.

A good wholesome tv drama. I am captivated by lark rise to candleford. Just enough scandal to keep you interested. A story of love, life and learning. One of the best I have watched in a long time!  Must see!
I found the character development to be excellent and loved how they portray the simpler times. I will long remember the characters in Larkrise and Candleford.
If you have read any of English history, you will certainly enjoy the connection between Lark Rise and Candleford.  I can hardly wait for season 3.

This is a great show!  I have really enjoyed this British drama and look forward to seeing what is happening in Candleford.  The characters are very interesting and the plot lines are remind me of good family dramas where people care about one another in a era of time gone by.  A wonderful distraction.

The characters here in Lark Rise, Candleford, and Ford Low are splendid, fully-rounded folks from all walks of life.

Watch for yourself and see which character resonates most within you.  I've watched this series over and over ... it's a feel good view of human nature and relationships.  As Dorcas Lane would say, "it's my one weakness" ;-D

The right ingredients are all here for an entertaining television drama. Season 1 introduces the narrator, Laura who comes from a humble, country village and leaves her home there to take on a position at the Post Office in a slightly larger, more upscale country town - whose inhabitants consider themselves refined. As the episodes move forward, new characters are introduced and established members of the supporting cast fade away into untold storylines. Most of the rollicking good fun and romance, I found to be in series' 1 & 2. As with many shows, series 3 is where the writing begins to falter, but still quite watchable.

I just loved this program. I looked forward to it. I'm sure it could have continued for a long time. I can think of so many story lines they could have used. Now I guess I'll have to find something else to watch.

I thought I loved Season 1 but Season 2 only gets better and better!  I watched the episodes on my iPad with earbuds and was transported back in time to my own little place in the world.  Have already seen Season 3 which is wonderful too.  Highly recommend this for anyone!!!
I absolutely think that this is the best mini series I've whatched in years. I loved it. I recommend it if you liked British TV drama.

I loved each and every one and was so sorry it ended. Each character was played excellent. The clothing chosen for the era was beautiful. The actors were absolutely great. I love to watch not having commercial interruptions and best of all no foul language. Very family orientated. When does season 4 come out. PLEASE notify me.

I love Jane Austen movies and Cranford. This series is really nice because there are so many episodes. I feel like I know the characters well. There are humorous characters and stereotypical characters that you can identify in your own life. A pleasant way to spend 24 hours.

I honestly was taken away in this entire series.  I love the characters, the interactions and how well everything fits together.  Characters grow in each episode and learn new things about themselves and those around them.  There is love, and dislike and intrigue.
Keeps me watching!!
Delightful continuation of an intimate look into village life in rural England. Great performances by all make you feel like you are part of the families.
I really loved season 2 because I really got to like James.  His getting to know Miss Lane was wonderful.
This is a great series, combining lighthearted humor and drama. It is a good examination of a variety of human experiences and characters. And certainly fun to watch.

I loved Season 2 of Lark Rise series; just as much, if not more than, the first season.  Each episode made me feel as if the characters are old friends and I was viewing events in their lives.  It's nice to have a simple story without huge special effects that sometimes deter from the real meaning.  They always left me wanting to watch more.

GREAT SERIES!!  Watched all 4 seasons and loved each and every one of them!  Characters, story lines, scenery, and life lessons in each episode make "Lark Rise to Candleford" a series you will enjoy and miss when it has ended.  I  loved it even more than Downton Abbey!
A gentle look at people living in two neighboring villages.  All the warmth and heart aches that go along with living simply and trying to get along while experiencing life's ups and downs.

This is, of course, the very necessary second season of the show. It would have been a travesty for it to have ended after season 1 and it is a quite delightful continuance. Please see my commentary on season 1 to decide if you would like to watch Lark Rise to Candleford. My previous commentary is as true of season 2 as it is of season 1.
I loved it. I got hooked with season one and had to know how their lives went on. Nice clean story

Almost "Little House on the Prairie" set in 1800's English countryside.  A wonderful family oriented series, with beautiful life lessons.  Queenie is a font of real life wisdom.  We were so disappointed that the series ended after only 3.5 years.
Great for family and friends to watch together,scenery is beautiful. Also good life lessons taught. Wish the show wouldn't have to end.
Love period pieces that are clean- I don't have to cringe or worry that something disgusting is going to come up. Well acted. Easy to feel a part of the lives of the people.

It was the most enjoyable program I have ever watched. The acting, directing and settings were superb! I sincerely hope it will continue some day. I enjoyed it much more than Downton Abby because the characters were so much more believable. I especially loved Twister and Queeny. It could not have been better.
Awesome!  See my review so season one for my review!  I loved it. Nnnnnnnnnn.  Nnnnm n nnnnnnnnnjjkkkjhkkmhhbvjbdhnnjgtj. Vhmbgghxichikjnvffhhjjhgfghnmk night humbg
I love this series.  The characters are so interesting and likeable.  I look forward to watching each episode and don't want it to end.  It is so nice to watch a good clean movie with high integrity.
I would say this is the British version of our Little house on the Prairie.  My favorite way to watch, was with knitting needles in my hands.
I thourghly enjoyed this series. I would watch two or three a day and was sad to see it end.

This show develops the characters carefully and thoughtfully. They and the plots are rich with a blend of drama, nostalgia, and tension. The characters are also rich and fully developed.

If you enjoy period dramas with quality writing and careful consideration, give this a try. It took me a few episodes to get pulled in but I'm hooked and thrilled--4 seasons to feast upon.

This series has the best character development of any show I've ever watched. Wholesome and believable story lines with excellent acting. The accents are hard to follow until your ear gets tuned to them. Historical accuracy of customs and terminology makes you feel as if you are living the episodes instead of merely observing.

My only complaint is that there is an end to this series and I am fast approaching it.
Enjoyable in every way.
I absoltely love this show.  The characters, setting, and costumes are all beautifully done.  I only wish there were more seasons!
Loved this second season, couldn't wait for it to come out. I was not disappointed. Hope they keep it coming.
Heartwarming series...great for the whole family. You will fall in love with the characters of Lark Rise and look forward to the next episode.

I finished Downton Abbey and went looking for something new. This was fantastic and I has Brendan Coyle ( Mr Bates !!) as one of the main characters. Wonderful actor, great story. My daughter and I truly enjoyed it.
Lark Rise to Candleford Season 2, is even more inviting then Season 1.  Season 1 a person begins to like the charters, but Season 2 you love the charters.

I love this series, love the characters, story lines. Highly recommend get very much involved and can't wait to watch the next episode. If at first you think is a little slow or you won't like it , give it a chance you won't be disappointed.
I don't know if this ever aired in the US but I am sorry I missed it if it did. It is a wonderful, heartwarming series. Watch all the seasons, you will enjys it!

beautiful scenery and characters that hold your attention.
sometimes a bit too "out there" with the superstitious locals
individual actors are excellent
It takes time to learn the characters, but once you do the series builds on these character lines and it becomes more endearing.  At first the story line is a bit slow but if you bear with it you will enjoy it if you love period pieces.
This is a great BBC series. It is so nice to be able to watch something without language, sex and violence. Keep these kinds of shows coming!
Awesome.  If you are in Downton Abbey withdrawal watch this instead.  You won't be disappointed as you are drawn in.
Good, if not better than season 1. Strong characters, well-written stories, solid acting. Moving stories of real life. Struggle and joy co-mingle to create a tapestry of love.

It's always a surprise to me when I find people who don't watch PBS or who have never heard of Lark Rise to Candleford. I enjoy it even more than Downton Abbey. The story is about parts of British society that are less well represented in film or tv (the poor and middle class), and the characters are very well drawn. Set on the cusp of the modern era, the issues of change are handled with a deft hand showing the range off reactions, but even more appealing are the family relationships. Best to start with season one, though to fully understand the story.

I loved this series about the relationships between family, friends, and neighbors; the struggle of poverty and hard work and the need to improve one's station in life.  I was so disappointed that it just abruptly ended in the middle of the season.  So sad to not be able to properly say goodbye to the characters.

Rural Victorian England entering its modern age. Characters you want to hug, scold, and cheer for. An engaging story beautifully filmed. We all need a postmistress like this to serve as our better angel.
I loved this series and wish there were more. I love these dramas set in the past and am always grateful that I live now and not back then. Wonderful stories, wonderful actors.
Awesome story line. Very touching and gravitating. This series keeps you desiring for more and keeps you coming back for repeat viewing.
The BBC has done a super job of transfering Flora Thompsons journals and books into an excellent series on rural life in mid england in the Victoria era.

This is a very sweet series. The characters are endearing and the scenery is absolutely beautiful! It is mostly upbeat and leaves you with a happy feeling after viewing an episode. I am currently viewing season 3 and enjoying it. I am hoping that Dorcus ends up with a husband and one who is worthy of her.
Enjoyable family friendly viewing with interesting character and a charming setting. I wish they'd made a few more seasons of this series.
A great drama, which contrasts the lives of a poor rural village with the Middle Class Candleford. Warning- It can be addicting.

Firstly, I love seeing the historical aspect dramatized, as far as, the class hierarchy, & gender roles and, of course, the period wardrobes.  The storyline follows a singular idea and is then brought around in clever circle while the characters is given am opportunity to grow.
I love this series. It is inspiring, compassionate, loving and everything I want to see in a Series. So much better than murder and mayhem on TV these days.
I really enjoyed watching all of the seasons of this series. Great drama, characters, and life lessons. I hope they consider adding more seasons.

We watch an episode whenever there is nothing worth watching on TV.  As with most BBC series, the acting is excellent and the glimpse of life at the turn of the nineteenth century is enlightening.  Although the postmistress is far too breathty and Thomas far too silly, it is still worth your time.
This is a sweet gentle series that a family can enjoy together. No car chases or violence ! The characters have genuine affection for each other.  Fans of "parenthood" will also enjoy this show.

What can I say about Lark Rise?  It's wonderful, great, etc., but that would not do it justice.  If you're the type of person who thinks you were born in the wrong century....then this is for you.  If you're the type of person who love's anything about England...then this is for you.  If you're the type of person who longs for community...then this is for you.  If you're the type of person who puts yourself into the story, just out of camera's view...then this is for you.  ENJOY!

I love this series. They are fun to watch, intriguing, funny and have meaningful stories.

The characters are well-developed and wonderfully acted.
This is the second time watching this series, absolutely fantastic acting, characters, scenery, we watch every evening after supper.  Please watch you will enjoy.

This is a delightful show of a time period when your neighbors did all they could to help you, and problems were about food and family, not hard drives and paperwork.  Very relaxing and family oriented.
This is a good family show.  The characters are interesting.  There is no profanity, nudity or in your face sex scenes.
Very quaint but intelligent glimpse of an English town and its nearby hamlet. I would watch it again in the future.
Great acting and writing. The characters are well developed and the story line is credible. The writing and production are especially good.
What a delightful program.  This program is time well spent.  I wish there were more out there like this one.
Most episodes were very entertaining-If you watch all seosons, you will have characters you love as well as hate.  Luckily Sawahala Y Hallinan are very loveable.
I love this show, it's something the whole family can watch.  I'm so sick of violence, so this show is a breath of fresh air.
I love this series. The stories are so good. The acting is better. I will be very sad when the series is over. If you like good writing and acting this series is for you.
I loved it from beginning to end. I recommend it to everyone. Wish there was more cant get enough of it.

I have watched bits and pieces of this show over the years but could never tie it all together.  Well, getting the seasons as they started and grew has been such a delight.

I love PBS shows in this era.  It was a romantic and naive era that cannot be found today in most nations.

Thanks for taking us back to this era in time.

Wonderful characters, beautiful story telling, and understated humor. Each episode can teach you something about life. In addition to great acting and directing, the photography and visuals are superb. Highly recommended!

There are many lessons to be learned from the folks of Lark Rise and Candleford as they cope with and respond to the events in their lives and each other. Laura's insights as she wrote in her journal were inspirational.
I am so enjoying this program. The characters are very well-rounded, showing many sides of life.  This program would be an excellent tool for families to teach children many of life's lessons.

Lark Rise to Candleford takes me back to a time and place where I feel I am at home.  I love all the folks in both town and am sorry it is no longer being produced.  I guess Par in Lark Rise had to move to Downton with an alias in order to send money home to his family... So, Lark Rice lost an important citizen.
Long live Lark Rise
Greatly enjoyed this series, just wished there were more than four seasons. "Robert Timmins" left the show for the last season to become "Mr. Bates" on Downton Abbey.

I adore this series and watch at least two
episodes in a row! Looking foreward to many more intertaining chapters!

We are big fans of Upstairs Downstairs, Duchess of Duke Street and Downton Abbey at our household and were happy to discover Lark Rise to Candleford.  While perhaps not up to the level of the urban Elizabethan "soap operas", it does have an excellent cast, wonderful sets and a glimpse into life in the late 1800 just before the world started changing at a rapid pace.  Very enjoyable series
I love this series. It is real and full of relationships that work out their pain and are real people. We need to learn from them. They had little but so much
If you're a Downton lover, you'll truly enjoy this "fill-in" while waiting for the next Downton episode!  Obviously, you want to start with Season 1 of this series.
continues with small town life. No violence or cursing. Good family entertainment for all ages. Would highly  recommend. You will not be disappointed.
This season is where the series really gets rolling. The main characters gain complexity and the story begins to do a better job of intertwining Lark Rise and Candleford.
Beautiful scenery, enjoyable characters, wholesome plot lines. You'll enjoy Lark Rise if you need to escape to a simpler time where accents are lovely.
I am hooked on this series.  Well acted, written, produced....  I can't think of any criticism.  It is a feel good series.  So if you want action with explosions etc., this isn't for you.

You won't regret having this wonderful show in your dvd library. A tiny bit reminiscent of The Waltons and Little House On The Prairie, but much more "gritty" and with subtle lessons and flawed characters with which we can identify.

I highly recommend this series to who anyone who loves to watch British movies that back in time.  Lark Rise to Candleford has the most lovable characters.  Season 2 is just as great as Season 1.  Can't get enough!
As a Downton Abbey fan I am hungry for great British drama that develops characters so brilliantly- this series is IT!!
It is extemely well done with different and interesting stories and themes with each episode.  It shows a very different time and how problems were handled with care and love.
I love this whole  series and highly recommend it for purchase.  Beware though...my daughter accidently bought a pirated copy which she returned and reported.  Recommend using amazon.

This series is a celebration of life, and makes me long for simpler times. It was a great discovery, kind of addicting to watch, and I loved every episode. There is so much love in there. My only regret is that they canceled the show before its time.

Definitely a chick thing, this series made me so sad when it was cancelled. I'd watch a whole season at a time, it was so good. The kind of thing you can watch in marathon sessions while wrapped in a blanket with some warm tea, or cocoa, and be happy as a clam! lol
I enjoyed the 1st season okay but guess I was more bored than I thought with it because I don't feel that this was a good as the 1st.  It goes that way soemtimes doesn't it?
This is an excellent period drama that keeps you interested as the story unfolds.  It is a pleasant and enjoyable way to spend an evening.
Anytime I am excited about watching a whole series, I know that I am hooked, this season continued to build and enhance the writers story LOVE Minnie, looking forward to season 3
The series has wonderful characters.  It creates a plot out of everyday happenings and introduces enough new characters to hold interest

Watching Lark Rise to Candleford transports me into another place and time. I love visiting with Dorcas Lane! The characters are so honest,genuine, and articulate! This has a touch of all types of people.... All of the actors do a fabulous job, the scenery and settings are lovely, and the lessons learned in each episode are still applicable in our lives today. I have watched it over and over, so much so, that I consider Dorcas, Laura,The Pratt sisters and whole community...to be friends...ones I may visit and learn from whenever I choose. My one weakness is, if I do find something I like, I watch it over and over and over again. :) I think I like it better than Downton Abbey...and that is hard to beat.
This is a good show. I like it as much as downton abby. Me and my mother enjoy watching this. Its our one weekness.
5 stars. Always love this show. I hate that it is now over. I will miss it. The characters are fascinating and as true of all the British shows it is wonderfully casted.

I got my husband watching the BBC series and he loves these as much as I do.  One of the things I love about this one is that it's relaxing.  As soon as the movie starts, I can feel my BP calm.  It's not that it's without drama or interesting human relationships.. but it is like you are transported to another time and way of life.

I really do love this series and so does my husband.  We have to be careful not to watch too many episodes at once so it will last longer. ;-D

No where that I could find on the product description  did it say "won't play european disc on a north American player". It should have. On the contrary it deceivingly said the main feature will play on ALL bluray players, but special features will be in standard def. I've searched and searched tech websites and they all said the same thing. European blurays from region B will not play on North American (region A) players. Anyone else have this problem? Had to return the discs because my Sony bluray player wouldn't play this imported bluray. It might be nice if this info was included in the product description. Save me some hassle.

I found quite a few quotes said by some of the characters that I had to write down in my journal.  I liked season 1 as well, but season two is when I really started to fall in love with the characters.  Twister is so funny!  There are so many great actors here.  It's a gem.

If you enjoy watching shows where a majority of the characters eavesdrop, gossips, can't keep a confidence  etc lark rise to candleford is the show for you.
Dorcus Lane is the woman of character and example, she enjoys all of the above,  must be involved in everything that has nothing to do with her.
I wish I would have watched 1or 2 episodes before buying 3 seasons
Distasteful to me

The characters are developed in-depth so you can actually get to know them, and better connect to the story. It is a great combination of characters, drama, romance, small town fun, simplistic life, and historical fiction. I fully enjoy this series and highly recommend it.

I can't think of many people more anti-sappy, anti-Victorian period piece than me. seriously I scoffed at my wife's suggestion to start watching this series. Yet, here I am: giving this show a 5 star rating and recommending it to others. It's so well done, well acted, well written that you become engulfed and immersed in the story. The life lessons the show delivers are also very true and relevant today as they were in the pre Industrial and agrarian life in England. Heartbreaking, harrowing, riveting, this show will have you in a roller coaster of emotions from which you cannot escape. Through brilliant writing, setting and acting the characters become your companions, your enemies, your friend, your foe, your platonic loves, your youth and old age and everything in between. I cannot recommend it enough. A must see.

I love Lark Rise to Candleford and have been watching this series over and over for the last several years! Though I have the DVDs, I am now watching the series via Amazon Instant Video (Prime members get to watch it for free), and love it!

Season One of Lark Rise to Candleford tackles myriad themes, and is adapted from Flora Thompson's semi-autobiographical novel.
